function menuList(list,item,n) {
 var active = list+n;
 if (!document.getElementById) return true;
 var items = document.getElementById(list).getElementsByTagName(item);
 for (var i=0; it=items.item(i); i++) {
  var nd = it.attributes.getNamedItem('id').nodeValue;
  var cl = it.attributes.getNamedItem('class').nodeValue;
  if (cl.indexOf('selected')!=-1) cl = 'item selected';
  else cl = 'item'; 
  it.className = (nd==active ? cl+' active' : cl);
 }
 return false;
}
</script><meta name="waif" content="search"/><meta name="waif" content="encyclopedia"/><meta name="waif" content="index"/><meta name="keywords" content="search encyclopedia index"/><meta name="description" content="A current and comprehensive encyclopedia covering all the major branches of knowledge from astrophysics to Zimbabwe."/><link rel="stylesheet" href="/css/reference.css" type="text/css"/>

function jumpTo(formName)
{
	var index = document.forms[formName].category.selectedIndex;
	var cat = document.forms[formName].category.options[index].value;
	var url="#" + cat;
	//redirect to selected page
	document.location=url;
}
</script>

});

            j=d.createElement(s),dl=l!='dataLayer'?'&l='+l:'';j.async=true;j.src=
            '//www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id='+i+dl;f.parentNode.insertBefore(j,f);
    })(window,document,'script','dataLayer','GTM-NBS6K3');
</script>
<!-- End Google Tag Manager -->

function jumpTo(formName)
{
    var index = document.forms[formName].category.selectedIndex;
    var cat = document.forms[formName].category.options[index].value;
    document.location="#" + cat;
}
</script>

    });
};
sbGlideScriptElement.src = "http://www.springboardplatform.com/storage/js/sliding/sliding_unit.js";
if (top === self)
	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>
<body>

    </iframe>
</noscript>

<h3 id="arch-ushistory">U.S. History</h3>
<ul>
      <li><a href="/id/A0902416">U.S. History</a></li>
      <li><a href="/spot/bhmtimeline.html">African-American History</a></li>
      <li><a href="/timelines/americainworld.html">Significant U.S. Conflicts</a></li>

      <li><a href="/id/A0001291">Korean War (1950&ndash;1953)</a></li>
      <li><a href="/timelines/coldwar.html">Cold War</a></li>
      <li><a href="/id/A0001292">Vietnam War</a></li>
      <li><a href="/id/A0001293">Persian Gulf War</a></li>
      <li><a href="/timelines/banking.html">Banking</a></li>
      <li><a href="/us/history/campaign-finance-reform-timeline.html">Campaign-Finance Reform</a></li>
      <li><a href="/timelines/presidency.html">Changes in the Presidency</a></li>

title="Significant events by year from 1900 to the present">Homework Help</a></li>

width="22" height="20" class="factmonster" alt="Factmonster Logo"/><a href="http://www.factmonster.com/"
title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

		</ul>
	</li>

<span class="context noindex"><a href="/almanacs.html">Almanac</a>&mdash;<a href="/world.html">World</a></span> <!-- BodyText -->
<h1>Countries of the World</h1>
<p><strong>Each Country Profile provides information on:</strong><br /> Geography &middot; Maps &middot; Flag &middot;
    History &middot; Current ruler &middot; Area &middot; Population &middot;
    Capital &middot; Largest cities &middot; Languages &middot; Ethnicity/race
    &middot; Religion &middot; Literacy rate &middot; Economy &middot;
    Government</p>

            <h4>Population Statistics</h4>

                <li><a href="/ipa/A0004379.html">Area and Population of Countries</a></li>
                <li><a href="/ipa/A0004391.html">World's 50 Most Populous Countries</a></li>

                <li><b>More <a href="/ipa/A0873845.html">Population Statistics &raquo;</a></b></li>
            </ul>

            <h4>Political Overview</h4>
            <ul class="bulletList">
                <li><a href="/world/leaders/">Current World Leaders </a></li>

		</ul>
	</li>

	<li><a href="/sci.html" title="Health, Weather, Astronomy, Space, Aviation, Science, Inventions, Weights &amp; Measures, Math, Money, Computers, Internet, Environment, Nature" class="browser-only">Science &amp; Health</a>

  <h1 id="A0005971">Current
  Events</h1><!--BodyText-->

  <p>Read about the major news events from 1997 to 2016, including United States, world, and business and science news.  Find out what is currently happening around the world, and take a look back at the most important events for the past several years.</p>

    <h1 id="A0001196">World History and Timelines</h1>
<p align="center">Check out the 100 Most Significant Events of the Last Thousand Years, an ancient history timeline, world history timelines and more.</p>
    <div class="intro">
      <br clear="right" />

      <table align="right" border="0" class="graphseg" width="206">

          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>

<li><a href="/atlas/latitude-longitude.html"
title="Find longitude and latitude of places around the world.">Place Finder</a></li>
<li><a href="/atlas/calculate-distance.html"
title="How far is it? Find distances between cities/towns, land features, and more.">Distance Calculator</a></li>
<li><a href="/periodictable.php"
title="Interactive periodic table of the elements: atomic weight, melting/boiling points, more">Periodic Table</a></li>
<li><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html"
title="Conversion calculator: area, volume, length, time, and more; plus significant figures">Conversion Tool</a></li>
<li><a href="/calendar.php"
title="View any month, any year, in the Gregorian calendar">Perpetual Calendar</a></li>

title="Significant events by year from 1900 to the present">Year by Year</a></li>
<li><a href="/homework/"
title="Significant events by year from 1900 to the present">Homework Help</a></li>
<li><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/ip_icon_factmonster.gif"
width="22" height="20" class="factmonster" alt="Factmonster Logo"/><a href="http://www.factmonster.com/"
title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

><h1
id="A0001742"
>World and U.S. Geography</h1
>
<p align="center">View maps of the world, calculate distance between locations, find latitude and longitude, read about noteworthy explorers and more.</p>

<div align="center">
  <!--BodyText--></div>

><h1
id="A0001326"
>Structures and Buildings</h1
>
<p align="center">Find out where the tallest buildings and towers are located. Learn about the history of major structures, endangered places, famous buildings, bridges and landmarks, including the Seven Wonders and more.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>

+ ".scorecardresearch.com/beacon.js";el.parentNode.insertBefore(s, el);

<ul class="list">
<li><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/infotoolslogo.gif" width="105" height="22" alt="Infoplease Tools" />
<ul>
<li><a href="/math/calculator.html" title="Engineering/Scientific Calculator">Calculator</a></li>

title="Find longitude and latitude of places around the world.">Place Finder</a></li>
<li><a href="/atlas/calculate-distance.html"
title="How far is it? Find distances between cities/towns, land features, and more.">Distance Calculator</a></li>
<li><a href="/periodictable.php"
title="Interactive periodic table of the elements: atomic weight, melting/boiling points, more">Periodic Table</a></li>

title="Conversion calculator: area, volume, length, time, and more; plus significant figures">Conversion Tool</a></li>

title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

		</ul>
	</li>

<div
  class="context noindex">  <a
  href="/world.html">World</a>  </div> <h1
  id="A0001437">Disasters</h1> <!--BodyText-->
<p>Find information about catastrophic natural and human-caused disasters. The following lists are not all-inclusive.
  Only disasters involving great loss of life and/or property, historical
  interest, or unusual circumstances are listed. For additional information
  and the latest disasters, see <a
  href="/ipa/A0005971.html">Current Events</a>. </p>
 <div class="intro">
      <br clear="right" />

     <table align="right" border="0" class="graphseg" width="206">
        <tr>
          <td><img src="/images/earthquake-aftermath.jpg" width="200" height="290" border="0" alt="earthquake aftermath" /><br />
			<p class="caption">The aftermath of a tornado in Oklahoma. Source: AP Photo/Sue Ogrocki</p></td>
      </tr>
    </table> </div>

>World</a

><h1
id="A0201477"
>Flags From Around the World</h1
>
<p align="center">See images of every flag in the world and of each U.S. state. Read a timeline of the U.S. flag, learn about the symbolism of the Irish flag, and more.</p>
<div align="center">
  <!--BodyText-->
</div>

class="toc"

>S&atilde;o Tom&eacute; and Pr&iacute;ncipe to Zimbabwe</a
></p

>U.S. Flag Timeline</a
></p>

    <h1 id="A0004372">World Statistics</h1>
<p align="center">Here you will find population, social, economic, health and political data on every country in the world.</p>
    <div align="center"><!--BodyText-->
      
    </div>
    <table align="left" cellpadding="20" class="toc" width="40%">

                      </p>

                      </p>

<div id="footerleft">
<h3>Popular Areas</h3>
<ul>
    <li><a href="/yearbyyear.html">Year-by-Year</a></li>
    <li><a href="/encyclopedia/">Encyclopedia</a></li>

  <p align="center">Find information on the United Nations, other international organizations, embassies, U.S. diplomatic milestones, and more.</p>

>Society and Culture</a

><h1
id="A0001461"
>Religion</h1
>
<p align="center">
Find out about the major religions of the world, their traditions and culture, statistics, the largest churches in the U.S. and more.</p>
<div align="center">
    <!--BodyText--></div>

<table width="100%" border="0" class="cpalmchap" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tr><td colspan="3" align="left" valign="bottom" class="cpalmhead"><span class="cptitle">United States</span></td></tr>
<tr><td valign="top" align="left" colspan="3" class="cplinered"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/03IPChanImg_divarw_red.gif" width="25" height="6" border="0" alt="" /></td></tr>
<tr><td class="cpalmchappad1" width="106" valign="top" rowspan="1">
<br />
<a href="/states.html"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/us-map-channel-pages.jpg" class="cpalmimg" width="115" height="76" alt="U.S. map with stars and stripes" border="0" hspace="0" vspace="0" /> The Fifty States</a></td>
<td class="cpalmchappad" valign="top">
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004920.html">U.S. Statistics</a><br/>
	Stats on the U.S. economy, population, births and deaths, poverty, and more</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/states.html">The Fifty States</a><br/>
	The map, history, capitol, flag, tree, geography, symbol of each state</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0108476.html">U.S. Cities</a><br/>
	Population info, weather, facts, history, and landmarks of major U.S. cities</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/familytrends.html">Marriage &amp; Household Statistics</a><br/>
	U.S. households, marriage, divorce, adopted children, and more</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0193688.html">Race &amp; Population</a><br/>
	Population stats by race, plus data on immigration, diversity, and American Indians in the U.S.</div>

</td>
<td class="cpalmchappad" valign="top">
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0001523.html">Gender & Sexuality</a><br/>
	Information about women's and gay rights, women in Congress, domestic violence, the wage gap, sexual abuse</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004597.html">Military Affairs</a><br/>
	Weapons, casualties, summaries of U.S. and foreign wars, veteran and military personnel stats, and more </div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0110426.html">Postal Information</a><br/>
	U.S. and international postage rates, facts about stamps, and ZIP codes</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004878.html">Societies &amp; Associations</a><br/>
	Directory of U.S. societies and associations, from the AARP to the Zionist Organization of America</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004881.html">Crime & Law Enforcement</a><br/>
	Statistics on crime, arrests and prison population, and capital punishment in the U.S.</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0112586.html">Education</a><br/>
	Enrollment figures, stats on reading proficiency, SAT scores, and tuition info</div>

</t></td></tr>
</table>

 var winY;

  winY=document.body.offsetHeight-80;
 } else {
  winY=window.innerHeight-80;
 }

     url,

 if (win) {
  win.focus();
  return false;
 }
}

function goToState(formName) {
 var index = document.forms[formName].stateID.selectedIndex;
 var stateID = document.forms[formName].stateID.options[index].value;
 document.location = ="http://www.infoplease.com/ipa/"+stateID+".html";
}

<div class="context noindex"><a href="/us.html">United States</a></div>

<h1>Explore All Fifty U.S. States</h1>

<!-- BodyText -->


<p class="center"><b>Jump to:</b>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="#maps">Maps &amp; Flags</a>
 &#x2022; <a href="#trivia">Trivia</a>
 &#x2022; <a href="#population">Population &amp; Geography</a>
 &#x2022; <a href="#stats">Economic &amp; Social Comparisons</a></p>
<h3 class="browser-only">Click a state in the map below to find facts,
 statistics, historical information, and more.</h3>

  id="A0108476">U.S. Cities</h1> 
  <div align="center">
     
  </div>
  <p align="center">Find information on weather, population, facts, history, and landmarks of major U.S. cities
</p>

<h1>North America</h1>
<!-- BodyText -->

    // make sure ads display correctly
    $('#lb div #widgetbox_widget_parent_0').parent().parent().addClass('oversize').parent().addClass('oversizead');
    $('#lb #widgetbox_widget_parent_0').parent().addClass('oversize').parent().addClass('oversizead');
});
</script>

>

<div id="footernew" class="col-md-12 col-xs-12 col-sm-12">

<!--COL 1-->
<div id="footerleft">
<h3>Popular Areas</h3>

    <li><a href="/yearbyyear.html">Year-by-Year</a></li>

			<li><a href="/atlas/latitude-longitude.html">
Place Finder</a></li>

            <li><a href="/yearbyyear.html">Year by Year</a></li>
		</ul>
	</li>

</ul>
</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->
</div><!--navbar-default-->

<div
  class="context noindex"><a
  href="/society.html">Society and Culture</a></div><h1
  id="A0001523">Gender & Sexuality</h1>
  <p align="center"> Get information on Women's issues, LGBTQ rights, the wage gap, domestic violence, sexual abuse, women's suffrage,
  and other gender issues.</p>
  <div class="intro">
   
  </div>

  <div align="center">
    
    <!--BodyText-->
    <table align="center"
      cellpadding="20" class="toc" width="80%">

><h1
id="A0193688"
>Race &amp; Population</h1
>
<p align="center">Find data on population, immigration, diversity, and American Indians in the United States.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>

width="22" height="20" class="factmonster" alt="Factmonster Logo"/><a href="http://www.factmonster.com/"
title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

><h1
id="A0110426"
>Postal Regulations</h1
>
<p align="center">Find current U.S. and international postage rates, state abbreviations, postal codes, U.S. letter rates
since the Civil War, postal workers bitten by dogs, women who left their "stamps" on history, and more.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>

              <li><a href="/biography/educators-scholars.html">Educators &amp; Scholars</a> </li>
              <li><a href="/biography/philosophers.html">Philosophers</a></li>
            </ul>
          </dd>

          <dt><a href="/biography/sports-bios.html">Sports</a></dt>
          <dd>
            <ul>
              <li><a href="/biography/sports-tennis.html">Tennis</a>  </li>
              <li><a href="/biography/sports-baseball.html">Baseball</a>  </li>
              <li><a href="/biography/sports-golf.html">Golf</a></li>
            </ul>
          </dd>
        </dl>
      </td>
    </tr>
  </table>

  <table class="reset other" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
    <tr>

	</li>

+ ".scorecardresearch.com/beacon.js";el.parentNode.insertBefore(s, el);
})();
 </script>
<!-- End comScore Tag --><!-- SPRINGBOARD SLIDING VIDEO UNIT -->

sbGlideScriptElement.type = "text/javascript";
sbGlideScriptElement.onload = function() {
    var glideUnit = typeof SbSlidingUnit == 'undefined' ? parent.SbSlidingUnit : SbSlidingUnit;
    glideUnit.init({
        partnerId : 4175,
        widgetId : 'info003',
        cmsPath : 'http://cms.springboardplatform.com'
    });
};

	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>

    <h1 id="A0908502">People in the News</h1>

<div id='mr'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4543'></div></div></div><!-- -->
<div id='ssky'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4545'></div></div></div><!-- -->

<ul class="list">

	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>

             	<tr><td width="75">

                    <td> 
                    <span class="cprelcontent">This Day in History:&nbsp;</span><a href="/cgi-bin/dayinhistory" title="Click to see what happened on this day in history"><em>Gone With the Wind</em></a>     </td></tr>
          
</table>              

<br />

                    </td>
                    <td>

	<li><a href="/sci.html" title="Health, Weather, Astronomy, Space, Aviation, Science, Inventions, Weights &amp; Measures, Math, Money, Computers, Internet, Environment, Nature" class="browser-only">Science &amp; Health</a>

<div
  class="context noindex"><a
  href="/history.html">History and Government</a></div><h1
  id="A0873867">U.S. Presidents</h1><!--BodyText-->
  
  <p>The U.S. Presidency is one of the most powerful positions in the world.  Read about the varied men who have held this job, from George Washington to Barack Obama. Plus, enjoy photos of the Presidents' children and pets, and find out how much the job actually pays in cash.</p>
  <div class="intro"><table align="left" border="0" class="graphseg centered"
      width="40%">
      <tr>
        <td align="center" id="A0878166"><img alt="Hat & American flags" height="155" id="A0878167"
        src="/images/uspresidents.jpg" width="206" border="0"/></td>  </tr><br />
        <tr>  <td align="center" id="A0878166"><img alt="President Barack Obama"
        src="/images/BarackObama.jpg" border="0"/></td>  </tr><br />
		 <tr>  <td align="center" id="A0878166"><img alt="President George Washington"
        src="/images/gwashington.jpg" border="0"/></td>  </tr>
		
	  
    </table></div>

	<DIV class="context noindex"><A href="/history.html">History and Government</A>	</DIV><H1 id="A0873866">U.S. Government</H1>
<p align="center">Read current and historical biographies of every U.S. congressional member. Find information on 
minorities in Congress, U.S. Senate salaries since 1789, veto rates, government agencies, impeachment facts, and much more.</p>
    <div align="center"><!--BodyText-->
    </div>

<li><a href="/calendar.php"
title="View any month, any year, in the Gregorian calendar">Perpetual Calendar</a></li>
<li><a href="/yearbyyear.html"
title="Significant events by year from 1900 to the present">Year by Year</a></li>
<li><a href="/homework/"
title="Significant events by year from 1900 to the present">Homework Help</a></li>
<li><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/ip_icon_factmonster.gif"
width="22" height="20" class="factmonster" alt="Factmonster Logo"/><a href="http://www.factmonster.com/"
title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

		</ul>
	</li>

</ul>
</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->
</div><!--navbar-default-->

        <div id="inside">

      <a href="/history.html">History and Government</a>

          </div>

    <h1 id="A0873869">Supreme Court</h1>

    <!--BodyText-->

	<p>Familiarize yourself with the United States Supreme Court, made up of nine Justices who are appointed&#8212;for life&#8212;by the President.  Learn about important cases in U.S. history, who is currently serving on the Supreme Court (including Chief Justices past and present), and other facts about the Supreme Court.</p>
	
   <div class="center"> <div class="intro">
      <table border="0" class="graphseg centered" width="60%">
        <tr>
          <td id="A0878168">
            <img alt="U.S. Supreme Court" height="196" id="A0878169"
                 src="/images/usscourt.jpg" width="206" />
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
    </div></div>
	
    <table cellpadding="12" class="toc centered" width=60%">
      <tr valign="top">
        <td>
		  <p class="tocentry">
            
            <a href="/us/supreme-court/supreme-court-members.html">Current U.S. Supreme Court Members</a>

                      </p>
		  
          <p class="tocentry">
            
            <a href="A0101281.html">Past U.S. Supreme Court Members</a>

                      </p>

          <p class="tocentry">

            Justices of the U.S. Supreme Court</a>

                      </p>

          <p class="tocentry">
            
            <a href="A0875894.html">Supreme Court Facts</a>

                      </p>

            History</a>

                      </p>

                      </p>

            <a
            href="/us/government/supreme-court-decisions-2006-2007.html">Notable

>History and Government</a

><h1
id="A0873872"
>U.S. Historical Monuments and Landmarks</h1
>
<p align="center">Explore a variety of facts, images, and the significance of some of the most famous landmarks and monuments, including the Statue of Liberty, Mount Rushmore, and the White House.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>
<table
class="toc"
width="40%"
align="left"
cellpadding="20"
><tr
valign="top"
><td
><p

></p

>The White House</a

></p

></p

></p

<ul class="list">
<li><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/infotoolslogo.gif" width="105" height="22" alt="Infoplease Tools" />
<ul>
<li><a href="/math/calculator.html" title="Engineering/Scientific Calculator">Calculator</a></li>

</td>
</tr></table>

	Information about air pollutants, global warming, the greenhouse effect, world and U.S. energy consumption, oil reserves, animals, plants, and endangered species</div>

<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">

    <div class="context noindex">
      
      <a href="/sci.html">Health and Science</a>

          </div>

    <h1 id="A0004424">Astronomy</h1>
<p align="center">Discover facts about the solar system, planets, NASA, astronomical measurements, the Big Bang, a star's magnitude and more. </p>
    <div align="center"><!--BodyText-->
      
    </div>
    <table align="left" cellpadding="20" class="toc" width="40%">

><h1
id="A0004536"
>Aviation</h1
>
<p align="center">Check out milestones in aviation, Amelia Earhart's legacy, famous planes, the Wright brothers, world records and more.</p>

<div
class="context noindex"
><a
href="/sci.html"
>Health and Science</a
></div
><h1
id="A0004704"
>Environment and Nature</h1
>
<p
><b>Environment</b> covers air pollutants, global warming, the greenhouse effect, and other dangers to the planet.  It also includes a glossary of environmental terms as well as a brief directory of environmental organizations. <b
>Energy</b
> details world and U.S. energy consumption, renewable energy, the world's largest oil and gas reserves, and nuclear power.  <b
>Nature</b
> discusses the Earth's wide variety of animals and plants and its endangered species. </p
>
<!--BodyText--><table
class="toc"
width="40%"

.section table tr td { width:50%; padding:4px 12px; vertical-align:top;}
.section table tr td ul { margin:0; padding:0 0 0 10px; list-style:none}
.section table tr td ul li { background:url("http://i.infopls.com/images/grayBullet.gif") no-repeat;background-position:0 7px;background-size:3px 3px;padding:0 0 2px 15px;margin:0 0 6px 10px;font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;color:#515050}

.section table tr td ul li strong { font-weight:normal;}
.section table tr td ul li a { padding:4px 0; outline:none; color:#2d88ac; text-decoration:none}
.section table tr td ul li a:hover { color:#2d88ac; text-decoration:underline}
.section table tr td ul li a:active, .section table tr td ul li a:visited { color:#2d88ac;}


table.aquat ul.inline, table.aquat ul.inline li {background-image:none;margin-left:0;padding:0}
.section table tr td ul.fromFEN li ul, .section table tr td ul.fromFEN li ul li{padding-left:0;margin-left:0}


.beige { background-color:#f6fbfc;border:solid 1px #dcdcdc}
.aquat { background-color:#f6fbfc;border:solid 1px #dcdcdc}

.inline { margin-top:2px !important; padding-left:1em !important;}
.inline li { display:inline; font-size:90%;}

.fromFEN li { color:#900;}
.fromFEN li ul li { padding:0; font-size:95%; }
</style>

    <div class="section"><h2 id="nutrition">Nutrition</h2> <table
        cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="aquat">
        <tr>
          <td><ul>
		   <li><a href="/science/health/myplate.html">MyPlate: The updated nutritional guideline system</a></li>              <li><a href="http://www.infoplease.com/science/food/healthy-lunch.html">Ideas

              Sources</a></li>

    var glideUnit = typeof SbSlidingUnit == 'undefined' ? parent.SbSlidingUnit : SbSlidingUnit;
    glideUnit.init({
        partnerId : 4175,
        widgetId : 'info003',
        cmsPath : 'http://cms.springboardplatform.com'
    });
};
sbGlideScriptElement.src = "http://www.springboardplatform.com/storage/js/sliding/sliding_unit.js";
if (top === self)
	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>

><h1
id="A0004636"
>Inventions and Discoveries</h1
><!--BodyText-->

<p>Find a list of famous inventions and their inventors, important discoveries, inductees into the Inventors Hall of Fame, biographies of important inventors and innovators, and more.</p>

<div
class="context noindex"
><a
href="/sci.html"
>Health and Science</a
> > <a
href="A0001816.html"
>Science and Inventions</a
></div
><h1
id="A0873842"
>Life Science</h1
><!--BodyText--><table
class="toc centered"
width="440"
cellpadding="12"
><tr
valign="top"
><td
><p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0193009.html"
>Scientific Classification</a
></p
>
<p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="/dk/science/encyclopedia/human-body.html"
>Human Body</a
></p
>

<p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0779260.html"
>Oldest Human Remains in North America Found</a
></p
><p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0001819.html"
>Major Discoveries About Human Ancestors</a
></p
><p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0193003.html"
>Cloning: Facts and Fallacies</a
></p
><p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0193002.html"
>Cloning Milestones </a
></p
><p
class="tocentry"
><a
href="A0762176.html"
>Classification of the Dinosaurs</a
></p
><p

			title="Search for synonyms."><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/ip_icon_thesaur.gif"

			width="17" height="17" alt="Day in History"/>Day in History</a></li>	</ul>

><h1
id="A0006019"
>Computers, Internet, and Technology</h1
>
<p align="center">Find information about computers, the internet, and cell phones, including data on usage, the most popular items, and current trends.</p>

<span class="noindex context"><a href="/sci.html">Health and Science</a></span>

<div align="center"><h2 class="hlthw-title">Weather</h2></div>
<p>Get information on meteorology, climate, extreme temperatures and precipitation as well as weather disasters, including hurricanes, tornadoes, and lightning</p>

<table width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<!--BodyText-->
<tr><td valign="top" align="left" colspan="2" class="cplinered"><img SRC="//dev.infoplease.com/images/03IPChanImg_divarw_red.gif" WIDTH=25 HEIGHT=6 BORDER=0 ALT=""></td></tr>
<tr><td colspan=2 class="hlthw-tickercell">
<a href="/cgi-bin/weather"><b>Today's Weather Fact:</b></a> 
A lot of snow, even for Buffalo</td></tr>
<tr><td valign="top" align="left" colspan="2" class="cplineash"><img SRC="//dev.infoplease.com/images/03IPChanImg_divarw_ash.gif" WIDTH=25 HEIGHT=6 BORDER=0 ALT=""></td></tr>



<!-- featured links cell -->
<td valign="top" align="left" class="hlthw-primarylinks" width="50%">
<a name="dailyweather"></a><h3>Weather Disasters</h3>

<li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0778120.html">Deadliest Hurricanes in the United States</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0778121.html">Most Intense Hurricanes in the United States</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0778285.html">Costliest Hurricanes in the United States</a></li><li><a href="/spot/hurricanes.html">Hurricane Season</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0781541.html">Retired Hurricane Names</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0781539.html">Atlantic Hurricane Names</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/hurricanes-greatest-storms-earth.html">Hurricanes: The Greatest Storms on Earth</a></li>

<a name="climate"></a><h3>Climate</h3>
<ul class="hlthw">
<li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0762183.html">Climate of 100 Selected U.S. Cities</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004587.html">Average Daily Temperatures (&deg;F) in  Tourist Cities</a></li><li><a href="/science/weather/costliest-heat-waves.html">Costliest Heat Waves in the U.S.</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0851700">Weather</a></li><li><a href="/ce6/weather/A0812570.html">Climate</a></li><li><a href="/science/weather/moods.html">The Weather and Your Mood</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0002064.html">The Seasons</a></li><li><a href="/us/cities/worst-spring-allergies.html">America's Worst Cities for Spring Allergies</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0875657.html">Winter Weather Across America</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0001374.html">Wind Chill Chart</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0001412.html">Winter Indoor Comfort and Relative Humidity</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0769510.html">Air Pressure and Humidity</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/another-front.html">Air Masses, Fronts, and Pressure Systems</a></li><li><a href="/ipa/A0769510.html">Air Pressure and Humidity</a></li><li><a href="/ipa/A0769512.html">What Kind of Cloudy Is It?</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/clouds.html">Cloud Formation</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/ten-major-cloud-types.html">Cloud Types</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/forecasting-by-clouds.html">Clouds and Forecasting</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/moisture-humidity.html">Moisture and Humidity</a></li><li><a href="/cig/weather/bring-rain.html">Rain: Why Does it Rain?</a></li><li><a href="/cgi-bin/id/A0193171.html">Weather &amp; Climate Websites</a></li></ul>

<ul class="hlthw">

    });

sbGlideScriptElement.src = "http://www.springboardplatform.com/storage/js/sliding/sliding_unit.js";
if (top === self)
	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>
<body>

    </iframe>
</noscript>

><h1
id="A0001657"
>Weights &amp; Measures</h1
>
<p>Convert various measurements with our conversion calculator as well as find information on the metric system, U.S. customary system, currency conversion, cooking measurement equivalents, and sports measurements.</p>

<!-- almanac chapter listings -->
<table width="100%" border="0" class="cpalmchap" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tr><td colspan="3" align="left" valign="bottom" class="cpalmhead"><span class="cptitle">Calendar &amp; Holidays</span></td></tr>
<tr><td valign="top" align="left" colspan="3" class="cplinered"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/03IPChanImg_divarw_red.gif" width="25" height="6" border="0" alt="" /></td></tr>
<tr><td class="cpalmchappad1" width="106" valign="top">
<img src="//i.infopls.com/images/calendar-holidays.gif" class="cpalmimg" width="106" height="155" alt="" border="0" hspace="0" vspace="0" /></td>
<td class="cpalmchappad" valign="top" width="50%">
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/ipa/A0875653.html">Calendars</a><br/>
	2016, 2015 and past calendars, history of the calendar, leap year, time zones, and Chinese, lunar, Jewish, and other calendars</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/ipa/A0875655.html">Major Holidays</a><br/>
	History, traditions, and dates of religious and secular holidays, Chinese New Year, Jewish, Hindu, Islamic holidays, and more</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/ipa/A0875656.html">Other Holidays</a><br/>
	Dates and history of state holidays, birthstones, and wedding anniversary gift list</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/spot/holidays.html">Holidays in America</a><br/>
The dates, history, and traditions of the major holidays listed by month</div>
</td>
<td class="cpalmchappad" valign="top" width="50%">
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/calendar.php">Perpetual Calendar</a><br/>
	View any month, any year, in the Gregorian calendar and find events and holidays for each day</div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/ipa/A0900697.html">Clocks</a><br/>
	Info on water, pendulum, quartz, and mechanical clocks, and sundials </div>
<div class="cpalmchaplink"><a href="/ipa/A0875654.html">Seasons, Months, Days</a><br/>
	The meaning of the days of the weeks and months, the reasons for the seasons, daylight saving time, and astrological signs</div>
</td></tr></table>




<table border=0 class="cpalmreltitle" width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tr>
		<td valign="bottom" align="left" class="cpalmchappad" colspan="3">
			<div class="cpalmreltitle">Related Almanac Sections</div>
     	</td>
	</tr>

    <h1 id="A0875653">Calendars</h1>
<p align="center">Find current, past, Chinese, lunar, Jewish, and other calendars as well as features 
on the history <br />
of the calendar, leap year, time zones, and more.</p>
    <div align="center"><!--BodyText-->
      
    </div>

<!-- End comScore Tag --><!-- SPRINGBOARD SLIDING VIDEO UNIT -->

    glideUnit.init({
        partnerId : 4175,
        widgetId : 'info003',
        cmsPath : 'http://cms.springboardplatform.com'
    });

	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);

</script>

><h1
id="A0875654"
>Seasons, Months, Days</h1
>
<p align="center">
Learn the reasons for the seasons, daylight saving time, the meaning of the days of the weeks, months, and astrological signs.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>

    <div class="context noindex"><a
    href="/society.html">Society and Culture</a> &gt; <a
    href="A0001832.html">Calendar &amp; Holidays</a></div>

    <h1 id="A0875655">Major Holidays</h1>

    <p>Here is information about holidays throughout the year, such as New
    Years, St. Patrick's Day, April Fools, Christmas, Ramadan, Yom Kippur,
    Diwali, Chinese New Year, Cinco de Mayo, Groundhog Day, Mother's Day,
    Father's Day, Women's History Month, and more.</p>

    <!--BodyText-->

    <table cellpadding="12" class="toc centered" width="440">
      <tr valign="top">
        <td>
          <p class="tocentry">
            
            <a href="/calendar/holidays/christmas-carols.html">Christmas
            Carols</a>

                      </p>

            <p class="tocentry">
                
                <a

                    <td>
                    <span class="cprelcontent">Encyclopedia:&nbsp;</span><a href="/search.php3?query=Business&in=encyclopedia" title="Encyclopedia">Business</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/search.php3?query=Finance&in=encyclopedia" title="Encyclopedia">Finance</a><br><a href="/encyclopedia.html">Search the entire Columbia Encyclopedia</a> for more topics. </td></tr>
          
</table>

><h1
id="A0104511"
>Business </h1
>
<p align="center">Check out stats on U.S. companies, the stock market, including a Dow 101 feature as well as <br />
the biggest one-day declines, foreign trade, motor vehicles sales, and shipping.</p>

>Business and Finance</a
></div
><h1
id="A0193934"
> Economy</h1
>
<p align="center">Get stats on the U.S. economy, the federal budget, poverty, health insurance, employment and labor unions.</p>
<div align="center"><!--BodyText--></div>
<table
class="toc"
align="center"

<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">

    <div class="context noindex"><a
    href="/bus.html">Business and Finance</a> &gt; <a
    href="A0193934.html"> Economy</a></div>

    <h1 id="A0854971">Labor and Employment</h1>
<p align="center">Find statistics on employment, worker benefits, minimum wage rates, weekly earnings, and more.</p> 

    <div align="center">
      <!--BodyText-->
      
    </div>
    <table cellpadding="12" class="toc centered" width="440">
      <tr valign="top">
        <td><ul>
          <h3 style="font-size:16px">Layoff Statistics</h3>

          <li>
            
            <a href="/business/economy/metropolitan-areas-layoffs.html">50
            Highest Metropolitan Areas in 2006: Number of Extended Mass Layoff
            Events and Separations</a>

                      </li>

          <li>
            
            <a href="A0922416.html">Displacement Rates of Long-Tenured Workers
            by Age, Sex, Race, and Hispanic Origin, 1981&ndash;2000</a>

                      </li>

if (top === self)
	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>

    <h1 id="A0854972">Poverty and Income</h1>
<p align="center">Learn more about the results of the 2010 Census, poverty in the U.S., the richest Americans as well as statistics on income credit, debt, welfare, and more.</p>

    <div align="center">
      <!--BodyText-->
      
    </div>
    <table cellpadding="12" class="toc centered" width="440">
      <tr valign="top">
        <td><ul>
          <h3 style="font-size:16px">Poverty</h3>

  <li>
            
            <a
            href="/business/economy/2010-census-poverty.html">What the 2010 Census Tells Us About Poverty in the U.S.</a>
            
                        </li>
          
         <li>
            
            <a
            href="/finance/economy/people-poverty-characteristics.html">People
            and Families in Poverty by Selected Characteristics, 2010 and
            2009</a>

            and Families in Poverty by Selected Characteristics, 2008 and
            2007</a>

            and Families in Poverty by Selected Characteristics, 2006 and
            2005</a>

title="View any month, any year, in the Gregorian calendar">Perpetual Calendar</a></li>

title="Fact Monster">Fact Monster</a></li>
</ul>
</li></ul>

</td>
</tr></table>

</ul>
</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->
</div><!--navbar-default-->

  <title>Distance Calculator: How Far Is It?</title>
  <meta name="description" content="Find global distances: distances to cities and towns, landmarks, parks, mountain peaks and other natural and man-made features." />
	<meta name="keywords" content="find distance calculator how far is it great circle city town land feature park building structure" />

  <div class="calculate distance">
    <span class="xlink"><a title="Find geographic coordinates of cities/towns, land features, and more" href="/atlas/latitude-longitude.html">Latitude/Longitude</a></span>
	<h1>Distance Calculator</h1>
		
	<span class="xlink plus">Find distances between cities/towns, land features, and more</span>
    <h2>How Far Is It?</h2>
    
    <form name="calc" action="calculate-distance.html" method="post">
      <fieldset class="distance-from">
        <label>Distance From:</label>
	    <input type="text" class="text" id="from" name="from" value="" onkeyup="ajax_showOptions(this,'getFeaturesByLetters',event)" />
	    <p class="example"><i>(example: Saint Moritz, Switzerland)</i></p>
	    <input type="hidden" id="from_table" name="from_table" />	    
	    <input type="hidden" id="from_id" name="from_id" />
	  </fieldset><!--/ distance-from-->
	  
	  <fieldset class="distance-to">
        <label>Distance To:</label>
	    <input type="text" class="text" id="to" name="to" value="" onkeyup="ajax_showOptions(this,'getFeaturesByLetters',event)" />
	    <p class="example"><i>(example: Jefferson Memorial, Washington DC)</i></p>
	    <input type="hidden" id="to_table" name="to_table" />	    
	    <input type="hidden" id="to_id" name="to_id" />
      </fieldset><!--/ distance-to-->
      
	  <fieldset class="submit">
        <input type="button" class="submit" id="submit" name="submit" title="Calculate great circle distance" value="Calculate" onclick="getDistance()" />
 	    <input type="reset" class="reset" id="reset" name="reset" title="Reset locations" value="Reset" onclick="reset()" />
	  </fieldset><!--/ submit-->
	  
	  
	  <div id="showDistance" class="answer" style="display:none;">
	    <p><b>Distance: </b>
	      <input type="text" id="miles" name="miles" readonly="readonly" value="" />
	      <label for="miles">miles</label>
	   
	      <input type="text" id="km" name="km" readonly="readonly" value="" />
	      <label for="km">kilometers</label>

	      <input type="text" id="naut" name="naut" readonly="readonly" value="" />
	      <label for="naut">nautical miles</label>
	    </p>
	  </div>
	    
	  <div id="showLat-Long" style="display:none;">
	    <table summary="Coordinates in degrees, minutes, and seconds">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th class="text">Locations</th>
              <th class="dms">Latitude</th>
              <th class="dms">Longitude</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>

          <tbody>
            <tr>
              <td class="text">
                <input type="text" id="area1" name="area1" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
               <input type="text" id="lat1" name="lat1" readonly="readonly" value="" /><input
                      type="hidden" id="declat1" name="declat1" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
                <input type="text" id="long1" name="long1" readonly="readonly" value="" /><input
                      type="hidden" id="declong1" name="declong1" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
            </tr>
        
            <tr>
              <td class="text">
                <input type="text" id="area2" name="area2" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
                <input type="text" id="lat2" name="lat2" readonly="readonly" value="" /><input
                      type="hidden" id="declat2" name="declat2" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
                <input type="text" id="long2" name="long2" readonly="readonly" value="" /><input
                      type="hidden" id="declong2" name="declong2" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
            </tr>
          </tbody>
        </table>
        
        <p class="tfoot">The units of measurement for geographic coordinates are degrees (&#xb0;), minutes ('), and seconds ("). For more information see our <a href="/ipa/A0908193.html">Geography Glossary</a>. Distance is calculated as air distance or "as the crow flies".</p>
      </div>
    </form>
  </div>
  
  <p class="attention"><b>Distance Calculator</b> now supports locations worldwide!</p>
  
  <div class="legal">
    <p>Names and locations in this distance calculator are from the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS), the federal standard for geographic nomenclature, developed for the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), and BGN database of foreign geographic feature names. No attempt has been made to supplement those names with others that may be in common use.</p>

    <p>Distance calculations are based on the WGS84 ellipsoid using <cite>geod</cite> (a part of the PROJ.4 Cartographic Projections library originally written by Gerald Evenden then of the USGS). The computation is for the <a href="/ipd/A0462942.html" title="Definition of 'great circle'">great circle</a> distance between points, and do not account for differences in elevation.</p>
  </div>

</td>

<td id="mktplace">
<div id='mr'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4543'></div></div></div><!-- -->
<div id='ssky'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4545'></div></div></div><!-- -->

			<li><a href="http://thesaurus.infoplease.com/">Thesaurus</a></li>
			<li><a href="/daily">Day in History</a></li>

		</ul>
	</li>


  	<li class="mobile-only"><a href="#" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" role="button" aria-expanded="false">Tools <span class="caret"></span></a>
		<ul class="dropdown-menu nav-links" role="menu">
			<li><a href="/math/calculator.html">Calculator</a></li>

Place Finder</a></li>

		</ul>
	</li>

</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->
</div><!--navbar-default-->

        <div id="inside">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" id="ipContentTable">
<tr>


<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">

<div style="clear:both;">&nbsp;</div>
<!-- AddThis Button END -->



  <div class="calculate lat-long">
    <span class="xlink"><a title="Calculate distances between cities/towns, land features, and more"
                           href="/atlas/calculate-distance.html">Distance Calculator</a></span>
    <h1>Latitude and Longitude</h1>
 	
 	<span class="xlink plus">Find coordinates cities/towns, land features, and more</span>
    <h2>Where Is It?</h2>
   
    <form name="lat_long"  method="post" action="latitude-longitude.html">
      <fieldset class="location">
        <label>Location:</label>
	    <input type="text" class="text" id="location" name="location" value=""
               onkeyup="ajax_showOptions(this,'getFeaturesByLetters',event)" />
	    <p class="example"><i>(example: Grand Canyon, Arizona)</i></p>
	    
	    <input type="hidden" id="location_table" name="location_table" />
	    <input type="hidden" id="location_id" name="location_id" />
	  </fieldset><!--/ location-->
	  
	  <fieldset class="submit">
	    <input type="button" class="submit" id="submit" name="submit" title="Find latitude and longitude"
               value="Get Coordinates" onclick="getCoordinates()" />
        <input type="reset" class="reset" id="reset" name="reset" title="Reset location" value="Reset" />  
	  </fieldset><!--/ submit-->

	  <div id="showLat-Long" style="display:none;">
	    <table summary="Coordinates in degrees, minutes, and seconds">
          <thead>
            <tr>
              <th class="text">Location
    <em id="MAPLINK">(<a href="/maps/lat-lon.html?ll=">see Map</a>)</em></th>
              <th class="dms">Latitude</th>
              <th class="dms">Longitude</th>
            </tr>
          </thead>
        
          <tbody>
            <tr>
              <td class="text">
                <input type="text" id="area" name="area" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
                <input type="text" id="lat" name="lat" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
              <td class="dms">
                <input type="text" id="long" name="long" readonly="readonly" value="" /></td>
            </tr>
          </tbody>
        </table>

        <input type="hidden" id="declat" name="declat" readonly="readonly" value="" />
        <input type="hidden" id="declong" name="declong" readonly="readonly" value="" />

          <p class="tfoot">The units of measurement for geographic coordinates in latitude and longitude are
          degrees (&deg;), minutes (&rsquo;), and seconds (&rdquo;). For more information see our <a
          href="/ipa/A0908193.html">Geography Glossary</a>. Distance is calculated as air distance or
          &ldquo;as the crow flies&rdquo;.</p>
      </div><!--/ showLat-Long-->

        

    </form>
  </div><!--/ calculate.lat-long-->
  
  <p class="attention"><b>Latitude and Longitude Finder</b> now supports locations worldwide!</p>
  
  <p><b>Where is Yosemite?</b> <b>Where is Glacier National Park?</b> You can find out with this tool. Unlike
  similar tools to find the location of <i>cities and towns</i>, we allow you to find the locations of <i>parks,
  mountain peaks, famous buildings and monuments, mines, dams, schools, and much more</i>. If it shows up on a
  topographic map in the U.S., we probably have it.</p>
	
	<div class="legal">
	  <p>(Names and locations used in this coordinate finder are from the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS),
      the federal standard for geographic nomenclature, developed for the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) by the
      U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), and BGN database of foreign geographic feature names. No attempt has been made to
      supplement those names with others that may be in common use.)</p>
	</div>
<!-- google_ad_section_end -->

<h1>Conversion Calculator</h1>


<table class="conmaintable" cellspacing="1" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="98%">

<tr><td align="left" colspan="2" height="3" class="contabletoprow"><img
src="//i.infopls.com/images/03UC_crumb.gif" width="7" height="3" alt="" border="0" /></td></tr>
<tr>
<!-- if no unit type is selected (intro pg), give the list of options: -->
<td colspan="2" align="left" valign="top" class="conlistarea">
<!-- icons -->
<table width="100%">
<tr>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=linear"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_linear12.gif" width="70" height="70" alt="Convert length/distance measurements" /></a></td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=area"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_area12.gif" width="51" height="70" alt="Convert area measurements" /></a></td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=volume"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_volume12.gif" width="44" height="70" alt="Convert volume measurements" /></a></td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=weight"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_weight12.gif" width="71" height="70" alt="Convert weight measurements" /></a></td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=temperature"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_temperature112.gif" width="72" height="70" alt="Convert temperatures" /></a></td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=cooking"><img border="0"
 src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_cooking12.gif" width="52" height="70" alt="Convert cooking measurements" /></a></td>
<td>       </td>
<td><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=time"><img
border="0" src="//i.infopls.com/images/03units_time12.gif" width="42" height="70"
alt="Convert time measurements" /></a></td>
</tr>
</table>
<br />
<!-- end of icons -->
<div class="conintrounits">
<!-- column 1 -->
<div class="conleftcolumn">

<div class="conintrounithead">LENGTH/DISTANCE</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=linear&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">inches, meters, miles, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=linear&amp;grp=metric">metric units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">centimeters, meters, kilometers, and more</div>

<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=linear&amp;grp=surveyor">surveyor's units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">links, poles, chains, and more</div>

<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=linear">all units</a></div>
<br />

<div class="conintrounithead">AREA</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=area&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">square feet, square miles, hectares, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=area&amp;grp=metric">metric units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">square centimeters, square meters, square kilometers, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=area&amp;grp=surveyor">surveyor's units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">acre, section, township, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=area">all units</a></div>
<br />


<div class="conintrounithead">VOLUME</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=volume&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">fluid ounces, pints, gallons, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=volume&amp;grp=metric">metric units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">milliliters, deciliters, cubic centimeters, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=volume">all units</a></div>
<br />

</div>

<!-- column 2 -->
<div class="conrightcolumn">

<div class="conintrounithead">WEIGHT/MASS</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=weight&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">ounces, pounds, tons, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=weight&amp;grp=metric">metric units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">milligrams, grams, kilograms, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=weight">all units</a></div>
<br />

<div class="conintrounithead">TEMPERATURE</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=temperature">all units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">Fahrenheit, Celsius, Kelvin, Rankine</div>
<br />

<div class="conintrounithead">COOKING</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=cooking&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">tablespoons, cups, pints, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=cooking">all units</a></div>
<br />

<div class="conintrounithead">TIME</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=time&amp;grp=common&amp;grp=common">common units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">minutes, days, years, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=time&amp;grp=common&amp;grp=astrotime">astronomical units</a>:</div>
<div class="conintrodetails">mercury days, sidereal years, lunar years, and more</div>
<div class="conunitdetaillink"><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html?unittype=time">all units</a></div>
<br />

</div>

</div>

</td>

</tr>

<!--BodyText-->



<a name="cite"></a><h1>Citing Infoplease</h1>


<p><strong style="color:#990000;">Regarding Reprinting or Republishing Infoplease Content</strong><br />
 <b>You may not reprint or republish Infoplease content  without first obtaining our permission.</b> Please complete a <a href="/contact.html">permissions request</a> form to inquire about using Infoplease content. </p>

<p><strong>How to Cite Infoplease</strong><br />
You may use our information as a source for your school projects, but you need to credit (cite) Infoplease as the source. 
</p>

<p>To cite a Infoplease content page&#8212;when you are on that page&#8212;click on the "cite this page" icon ( <img src="//i.infopls.com/images/IPcite.gif" width="20" height="20" style="vertical-align:middle;margin:0;"/> ). You will find it at the top of the page and at the bottom, under Infoplease Tools. A pop-up window will appear with a customized page citation. If a pop-up does not appear use the examples below for guidance.</p>

<p>There are several types of articles to cite on Infoplease. The list below shows the information you need to include and gives you a sample citation for each type of article. Infoplease citations follow the MLA style.</p>

<ol>

<li><b>Almanac articles</b><br />
Article title in quotation marks. Website title.<br />
Copyright date and company name.<br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><i><b>Example:</b></i><br />
<ul>"1999 National Events Wrap-Up." Infoplease.<br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/ipa/A0765967.html&gt;.
</ul><br />

<li><b>Feature articles</b><br />
Author's name, last name first.<br />
Article title in quotation marks. Website title.<br />
Copyright date and company name.<br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><b><i>Example:</i></b><br />
<ul>Haney, Elissa. "Kosovo Factsheet." Infoplease.<br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/spot/kosovo1.html&gt;.</ul><br />

<li><b>Encyclopedia articles</b><br />
Article title in quotation marks.<br />
Encyclopedia name (in italics). (Copyright date) on Website title.<br />
Website copyright date and company name.<br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><i><b>Example:</b></i><br />
<ul>"William Shakespeare." <i>The Columbia Electronic Encyclopedia.</i>  &copy; 1994, 2000-2006 on Infoplease.  <br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/ce6/people/A0844662.html&gt;.</ul><br />

<li><b>Dictionary entries</b><br />
Entry title in quotation marks.<br />Dictionary name (in italics)<br />
(Copyright date) on Website title.<br />
Copyright date and company name<br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><i><b>Example:</b></i><br />
<ul>"Lexicography." <i>Random House Unabridged Dictionary</i>.<br />
&copy; 1997 by Random House, Inc., on Infoplease.<br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/ipd/A0515599.html&gt;.</ul><br />

<li><b>Thesaurus entries</b><br />
Entry title in quotation marks.<br />Thesaurus name (in italics)<br />
(Copyright date) on Website title.<br />
Copyright date and company name<br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><i><b>Example:</b></i><br />
<ul>"Compliant." <i>WordNet 2.0</i>.<br />
&copy; 2003 by Princeton University on Infoplease.<br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/thesaurus?word=compliant&x=10&y=6&gt;.</ul><br />

<li><b>All other articles:</b><br />
Article title (if possible) in quotation marks.<br />
Feature Type (in italics). Website title.<br />
Copyright date and company name. <br />
Access date and full URL in angle brackets.<br />
<br /><i><b>Example:</b></i><br />
<ul>"How many eggs were consumed per person in the U.S. in 1996?"<br />
<i>Ask the Editors.</i> Infoplease. <br />
&copy; 2000–2015 Sandbox Networks, Inc., publishing as Infoplease.<br />25 May. 2016&nbsp;&lt;http://www.infoplease.com/askeds/3-26-99askeds.html&gt;.
</ul>
</ol>
<br /><br />
<b>See <a href="/helpfaqs.html#permission">Frequently Asked Questions</a> for further information.</b>
</font>

<!-- AddThis Button END -->




<div id="FAQs">

<h1>Searching and Browsing Infoplease</h1>

<!--BodyText-->

<h2 id="searching">Search</h2>

<div class="questions">
<h3>Simple Search</h3>
<p>To search, simply type the words you want to look up in the search box above and click the "Search" button. This will search all of the <i>Infoplease Almanacs<sup>&#174;</sup></i>, plus the <i>Columbia Encyclopedia</i> and <i>Infoplease<sup>&#174;</sup> Dictionary</i> in one click.</p>

<h3>Focused Search</h3>
<p>For a more focused search, you can narrow your reference sources. Click on the pull-down menu (the arrow to the right of "All Infoplease"), highlight and click on the desired source ("All Almanacs," "Biographies," "Sports," "Entertainment," etc.), and then click "Search" to view the results.</p>

<h3>Search Tips</h3>
<p>Searches are <b>not case-sensitive</b>. This means a search will include all occurrences of your word, whether capitalized or not. <b>Different forms</b> of words, such as "volcano" and "volcanoes", are considered the same for searching purposes. <b>Accented letters</b> can also be found by typing either the accented or unaccented form: to search for <i>el ni&#241;o</i> you can type <i>el nino</i>.</p>

<p>If you enter <b>more than one word</b>, pages containing the phrase will be listed first, followed by pages that contain the individual words.  You request exact matches only by using <b>quotation marks</b> around the entire phrase, in which case only matches to the phrase will be listed.</p>
</div>

<div class="jumpup"><p><a href="#FAQs">Back to Top</a></p></div>

<h2 id="browse">Browse</h2>

<div class="questions">
<p>You can <a href="/almanacs.html">browse the entire content of our almanacs</a> or click on the navigation bar at the left to browse these specific almanac categories:</p>

<ul>
  <li><a href="/world.html">World &amp; News</a></li>
  <li><a href="/us.html">United States</a></li>
  <li><a href="/history.html">History &amp; Gov't</a></li> 
  <li><a href="/people.html">Biography</a></li>
    <li><a href="/sports.html">Sports</a></li>
      <li><a href="/ent.html">Arts &amp; Ent.</a></li>
    <li><a href="/bus.html">Business</a></li>
  <li><a href="/society.html">Society &amp; Culture</a></li>
  <li><a href="/sci.html">Health &amp; Science</a></li>
</ul>


<p>The navigation bar on the left of the page will assist you as you move from page to page. These links on the navigation bar may be helpful when browsing:</p>

<ul>
  <li>The <a href="/index.html">Home</a> tab takes you to our home page, which provides a quick table of contents of the site.</li>
  <li>Our <a href="/daily">Daily Almanac</a> offers timely information including <a href="/birthday">Today's Birthdays</a>, <a href="/cgi-bin/word">Word Quiz</a>, <a href="/dayinhistory">This Day in History</a>, and <a href="/ipa/A0197622.html">Link of the Day</a>.</li>

<li><b style="color:#060;"><i>Kids!</i></b> Bookmark the <a href="/homework/">Homework Center</a> for resources to help with school assignments.</li>

</ul>
</div>

<div class="jumpup"><p><a href="#FAQs">Back to Top</a></p></div>

<p><b>Didn't find what you were looking for?</b></p>

<p><b>Let us know! </b><a href="/contact.html">Send us an email</a>, and we'll help you find any answer that is available on the Infoplease website.</p>

</div>

<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">




<!-- AddThis Button BEGIN -->
<div class="addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style"
style="float:right;width:auto;height:auto;margin:0 6px 0 0;padding:0;border:1px solid #fff;background-color:#fff;">

</script>

<a href="/citing.html"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/IPcite.gif" style="vertical-align:middle;">Cite</a>

<div style="clear:both;">&nbsp;</div>
<!-- AddThis Button END -->



<h2>Preface</h2><p><i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> began its existence in the 1920s when Clarke Fisher Ansley and Columbia University Press recognized the need for a first aid for those who read. They envisioned and created a handy, reliable one-volume encyclopedia that would be a suitable companion to a good dictionary and atlas. Now in its sixth edition some 80 years later, <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> continues to serve the purposes for which it was conceived.</p>
<p>Like the world we live in, the contents within this book have changed in many significant ways since the first edition, but even the seven years since the last edition have seen changes of great importance. In the early 1990s electronic mail was unknown to most Americans and the World Wide Web was just being born; now they have transformed the Internet into an inescapable part of our lives, both at home and at work. Inside this encyclopedia's covers you will find articles on electronic mail and the Web as well as on many other aspects of the computer revolution that affect our lives, from the personal computer and the modem to the smart card and repetitive-stress injury.</p>
<p>Reference books, too, have been affected by the computer revolution, and some days it seems that the death of the printed encyclopedia is here. Those of our readers who feared that this would happen to <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> need fear no longer. With this new edition of the book, Columbia University Press reaffirms the vision that first led it to publish this work. That vision has not been voided by the information revolution. Readers continue to want a book that, with the flip of the page, can be turned to for information whenever needed. This encyclopedia remains the handiest one-stop, one-volume solution for that need, capable of being powered up by the mind and connected to by the desire to learn.</p>
<p>A few minutes spent looking up China can turn into an absorbing hour devoted to following the trail of our many cross-references and delving into China's provinces and cities, its ancient dynasties and modern rulers and political parties, and its rich literature, art, and architecture. Each time the encyclopedia is opened a similar journey can begin, and it is the rare reader who has not been fascinated by what there is to know about the world. More than 80,000 cross-references—the original and still highly functional predecessor of hypertext—will lead you from entry to entry on the countries, regions, and cities of our world; the plants and animals with which we share this planet; and those men and women who have made and are making history in government, business, the sciences, and the arts. You cannot learn everything here, but <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> remains quite a kit for first aid.</p>
<p>The sixth edition of <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> encompasses the discoveries, crises, and other events of the 1990s—and of the 1900s and the innumerable decades and centuries gone before. For a one-volume work, the scope is immense. The nearly 51,000 entries in the encyclopedia marshal six and a half million words on a vast range of topics. Changes in the arts and literature, in mathematics and physics, in medicine and politics, in society and sports, and in many other fields can be found in the articles within this book. The turmoil in the former Yugoslavia, in the Caucasus, in equatorial Africa, and in East Timor is recorded here, as are the events at home surrounding the impeachment of President Clinton. The genetic and reproductive revolutions in all their complexity will also be found within our pages: the hopes and challenges of gene therapy and the Human Genome Project, the seeming miracles and ethical problems enmeshed in in vitro fertilization and surrogate motherhood.</p>
<p>The encyclopedia always has been both informative and a pleasure to read, and we are pleased to say—and our loyal readers will be pleased to hear—that it remains as it was. The editors and writers who have produced this edition have striven to provide our readers with useful articles that are both reliable and readable: accurate, perceptive, concise, and at times even a little witty. In this they were no different from their predecessors, and although this edition is the work of new writers, researchers, and editors, the encyclopedia is also the product of the accumulated effort and insights of all those who labored before us, both on <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> itself and on <i>The Columbia Gazetteer of the World,</i> another of the Press's signature reference works.</p>
<p>Nearly 1,300 new entries grace this volume, and almost 40 percent of the existing entries were revised when preparing this edition. We have made a special effort to expand and enrich our computer, medical, and other science coverage, even while maintaining the traditional strengths that have made the encyclopedia a great reference work. For the first time we have paragraphed our longer articles, and we have added thousands more italicized subheadings, thus making the articles easier to read and information easier to find. As always, we have provided pronunciations where they are needed. About one quarter of our articles have bibliographies, which offer our readers the opportunity to explore a subject further in excellent basic reading. Where necessary we have supplemented the text of the articles with diagrams, tables, and maps. We believe it is something of a feat of book design and book production that so many words can be contained in a vehicle that is not only sturdy, durable, and portable but visually handsome.</p>
<p>My editorial colleagues on this project were professionals of the highest caliber, with decades of accumulated experience working on encyclopedias and other reference books; they were as knowledgeable, dedicated, and hardworking a group of people as anyone could hope to work with. William B. Strachan, President and Director of Columbia University Press, and James Raimes, Assistant Director of the Press for Reference Publishing, both brought a strong personal and institutional commitment to publication of the sixth edition. Linda Secondari, Nicholas Frankovich, and others at the Press devoted many hours to assuring that the encyclopedia's electronic files became the eminently readable book you see before you, and the staff at Impressions Books and Journal Services worked tirelessly and with great thoroughness to realize Rich Hendel's fine new design for this edition. I think I may say for all of us who worked on the book in so many different ways, both on this edition and on earlier ones, that we all regard this encyclopedia less as a book than as a kind of public trust. We always have committed ourselves to giving our readers the best, despite the imperfections that inhere in any human endeavor. We hope that those who use this encyclopedia experience the pleasure and insight that we have worked to provide.</p><hr width="65%" align="center"/><p align="center" class="source"><i>The Columbia Electronic Encyclopedia,</i> 6th ed. Copyright 2012, Columbia University Press. Licensed from Columbia University Press. All rights reserved.</p><!-- google_ad_section_end -->
<div style="padding:10px 0;">

</div>
</td>

<title>How to Use The Columbia Encyclopedia</title>

<script>
$(document).ready(function() {
    // make sure ads display correctly
    $('#lb div #widgetbox_widget_parent_0').parent().parent().addClass('oversize').parent().addClass('oversizead');
    $('#lb #widgetbox_widget_parent_0').parent().addClass('oversize').parent().addClass('oversizead');
});
</script>

        <div id="inside">



<div id="content">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" id="ipContentTable">
<tr>


<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">




<!-- AddThis Button BEGIN -->
<div class="addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style"
style="float:right;width:auto;height:auto;margin:0 6px 0 0;padding:0;border:1px solid #fff;background-color:#fff;">
<script type="text/javascript">
var addthis_config = {
data_track_linkback: true
}
</script>
<!--<a class="addthis_button_print"></a>
<a class="addthis_button_email"></a>

<span class="addthis_separator">|</span>-->
<a href="/citing.html"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/IPcite.gif" style="vertical-align:middle;">Cite</a>
</div>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://s7.addthis.com/js/300/addthis_widget.js#username=bethrowen"></script>
<div style="clear:both;">&nbsp;</div>
<!-- AddThis Button END -->



<h2>How to Use The Columbia Encyclopedia</h2><p><i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> is easy to use. All articles are arranged alphabetically with each article heading in boldface type. The headings of biographical articles are inverted and alphabetized by the subject's surname, with the exception of articles on some historical figures. Thus, William Faulkner appears as Faulkner, William, but Joan of Arc is listed as Joan of Arc.</p>
<p>The problem of alphabetizing names that include de, van, von, and the like has been resolved by employing as the heading the most commonly used form of the name. Accordingly, the composer Ludwig van Beethoven is entered as Beethoven, Ludwig van, while the painter Vincent Van Gogh is under Van Gogh, Vincent, with a cross-reference from Gogh, Vincent Van.</p>
<p>M', Mc, and Mac are listed as if they were spelled Mac. Thus the political leader McAdoo, William Gibbs, precedes the Scottish king Macbeth, who precedes the U.S. Secretary of Defense McNamara, Robert Strange. All three therefore precede Madonna. In each instance it is the letter or letters after the Mc or Mac that determine the alphabetical order. Exceptions to this rule are African names beginning with M'; they are listed in strict alphabetical order: M'Ba, Mbandaka, M'Bour, Mdina, etc.</p>
<p>Abbreviations are alphabetized as though they were spelled out (e.g., St. is alphabetized as Saint). Therefore, the heading St. Clair, Arthur is listed before Saint Clair, Lake, which precedes St. Denis, Ruth and the Dutch island Saint Eustatius. Again, in each case the first letter of the word after Saint determines the alphabetical order.</p>
<p>When two or more articles have the same heading, entries are alphabetized by category: persons, places, and things. Thus, if one were to look for an article heading with the name Chicago, Chicago, Judy (person) would precede Chicago, city (place), and that would precede Chicago, University of (thing). The order of entry for persons of the same name is determined by rank: saints, popes, emperors, kings, followed by titled nobility, such as crown prince, duke or count, baron, baronet, and so forth. Monarchs of the same name are listed numerically and alphabetically by country: Charles X, king of France, appears before Charles III, king of Naples, who in turn precedes Charles III, king of Spain.</p>
<p>Within some articles in <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia,</i> related material is introduced by subheadings in smaller boldface type. For example, in the article antiparticle there is a description of antimatter. The main heading contempt contains two boldface subheadings: contempt of court and contempt of Congress. If a reader wishes to have information on any one of these subheadings, it can be found directly without reading the entire article.</p>
<p>This method is also used for family articles. The Bach family article contains subheadings for seven members; three of these are cross-references to separate articles on Johann Sebastian Bach, Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach, and Johann Christian Bach.</p>
<p>Boldface numbers are also used in some multiple entries. For example, when several U.S. cities have the same name, they are listed alphabetically by state in a single article:
Jacksonville. 1 City (1990 pop. 29,101), Pulaski co., central Ark. 2 City (1990 pop. 635,230), consolidated (since 1968) with Duval co., NE Fla. 3 City (1990 pop. 19,324), seat of Morgan co., W central Ill. 4 City (1990 pop. 30,013), seat of Onslow co., E N.C.</p>
<p>Because space is limited in a single-volume encyclopedia, information provided in one article is generally not repeated in another. Instead, cross-references are used extensively in the text to guide the reader to various articles containing related material. References to those headings are printed in <i>small capitals.</i> An example of this system may be found in the article environmentalism, which has the following definition: movement to protect the quality and continuity of life through <i>conservation of natural resources</i>, prevention of <i>pollution</i>, and control of <i>land use.</i> All the articles mentioned in <i>small capitals</i> are in the encyclopedia and provide additional information; when read together, they will give the reader a basic understanding of this particular subject. There are many names mentioned in articles that are not indicated as cross-references, but this does not necessarily mean that there are no separate articles on these persons in the encyclopedia. Cross-references are used only as a means of suggesting that there is further information about the subject matter.</p>
<p>Cross-referencing makes an index in <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> unnecessary. Some boldface entries are cross-references directing the reader to appropriate headings (yeti: see <i>abominable snowman</i>). Others catalog references pertaining to a particular subject; for example, music provides some 70 cross-references while instructing the reader how to locate specific information:
music. For information on types of music, see such articles as <i>absolute music; aleatory music; chamber music; church music</i>. … In addition, see entries on the music of various nations and peoples, including <i>African music; Arabian music; Balinese music</i>… and <i>Jewish liturgical music</i>… , etc.</p>
<p>An additional aid to the reader is the bibliography that appears at the end of many articles. These books have been selected to enable the reader to expand his or her knowledge on a subject that cannot be treated at great length in a short-entry encyclopedia and, indeed, cannot be treated comprehensively in any encyclopedia. In order to save space not all books have been identified by title. Instead, the kind of work and the author are given; the author's given names may be replaced by initials. For example, at the end of the article on the American author Ralph Waldo Emerson there are bibliographic references to his letters, edited by R. L. Rusk and E. M. Tilton, and several biographies and studies, including ones by G. W. Allen and J. Porte. Although no specific titles are given, such works may be found without difficulty by consulting the catalog of a library.</p>
<p>Pronunciations have been provided for headings consisting of unfamiliar names or scientific terms; for many foreign names both native and anglicized pronunciations are shown.</p>
<p>In order to conserve space, many abbreviations are used in the text.</p><hr width="65%" align="center"/><p align="center" class="source"><i>The Columbia Electronic Encyclopedia,</i> 6th ed. Copyright 2012, Columbia University Press. Licensed from Columbia University Press. All rights reserved.</p><!-- google_ad_section_end -->
<div style="padding:10px 0;">
 
<div id="ld-2559-4525"></div>
<script>(function(w,d,s,i){w.ldAdInit=w.ldAdInit||[];w.ldAdInit.push({slot:8440289106995559,size:[0, 0],id:"ld-2559-4525"});if(!d.getElementById(i)){var j=d.createElement(s),p=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];j.async=true;j.src="//cdn2.lockerdome.com/_js/ajs.js";j.id=i;p.parentNode.insertBefore(j,p);}})(window,document,"script","ld-ajs");</script>
  
</div>
</td>

<td id="mktplace">
<div id='mr'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4543'></div></div></div><!-- -->
<div id='ssky'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4545'></div></div></div><!-- -->

<ul class="list">
<li><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/infotoolslogo.gif" width="105" height="22" alt="Infoplease Tools" />
<ul>
