Place Finder</a></li>
			<li><a href="/pages/unitconversion.html">Conversion Tool</a></li>
			<li><a href="/calendar.php">Perpetual Calendar</a></li>
            <li><a href="/yearbyyear.html">Year by Year</a></li>
		</ul>
	</li>

</ul>
</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->
</div><!--navbar-default-->

 <div id="page-wrap">
        <div id="inside">



<div id="content">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" id="ipContentTable">
<tr>


<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">




<!-- AddThis Button BEGIN -->
<div class="addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style"
style="float:right;width:auto;height:auto;margin:0 6px 0 0;padding:0;border:1px solid #fff;background-color:#fff;">

<a href="/citing.html"><img src="//i.infopls.com/images/IPcite.gif" style="vertical-align:middle;">Cite</a>
</div>
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://s7.addthis.com/js/300/addthis_widget.js#username=bethrowen"></script>
<div style="clear:both;">&nbsp;</div>
<!-- AddThis Button END -->



<h2>Acknowledgments</h2><p>The first five editions of <i>The Columbia Encyclopedia</i> were published in 1935, 1950, 1963, 1975, and 1993. All editions owe a debt of gratitude to Clark Fisher Ansley, the editor of the first edition, but the third edition also owes a debt to the second, and so on down to today. However, as the longest period of time between editions was that between the fourth and the fifth, and the shortest that between the fifth and the present sixth, it seems particularly appropriate to acknowledge the work of the editors, consultants, and advisers of the fifth edition.</p>
<p>The editors of the fifth edition were Barbara A. Chernow and George A. Vallasi. The consultants for the fifth edition were Peter J. Awn (humanities); Richard Bulliet (history); Saul B. Cohen (geography); Kelvin J. Lancaster (social sciences); Don Melnick (life sciences); and Erick J. Weinberg (physical sciences).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in the humanities for the fifth edition were: Ali Asani (Islam); Tom Baker (music); Ian Bent (music); Monica Berger (popular music); Pamela Biehl (Protestantism); Maurice Charney (film and drama); Antoine Compagnon (French literature); Jonathan K. Crary (American art); Vidya Deheijia (Eastern, primitive, and other art); Andrew Delbanco (American literature); Osborn Elliott (print and broadcast journalism); Robert Ellwood (minority religion); Iris M. Fanger (dance); Luigi Fontanella (Italian literature); Susan Hall (African literature); Inge D. Halpert (German, Dutch, and Yiddish literature); William H. Harkins (Russian and Slavic literature); Jay Harris (Judaism); Holland Hendrix (Latin and Greek literature and ancient religion); David Scott Kastan (British literature up to Dickens); Charles Larmore (philosophy); Maristella Lorch (Italian literature); Diane Marting (Spanish-American literature); Richard A. Norris (the Bible); Adolf K. Placzek (architecture); John Malcolm Russell (European art up to 1600); Michael Seidel (British literature since Dickens); Robert Somerville (Roman Catholicism); Irwin Stern (Spanish, Portuguese, and Brazilian literature); Janis Tomlinson (European art since 1600); Marsha L. Wagner (East Asian literature); James T. Walsh (music); Paul B. Watt (Asian religion).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in the social sciences for the fifth edition were: Vincent Blasi (law); Robert Carneiro (anthropology and archaeology); Lawrence Cremin (education); Donald Dewey (business, economics, and labor); Sigmund Diamond (sociology); Robert Jervis (political science and government); William Labov (language); Ellen Condliffe Lagemann (education); Deborah Mandelbaum (language); Benjamin Rader (sports and games).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in history for the fifth edition were: Karl Bottigheimer (Great Britain, Ireland, Australia, and New Zealand up to 1837); Caroline Walker Bynum (medieval Europe); David Cannadine (Great Britain, Ireland, Australia, and New Zealand since 1837); Mark Carnes (U.S. and Canadian history since 1939); Ainslie T. Embree (India and South East Asia); Carol Gluck (Japan and the Pacific Rim since 1900); W.V. Harris (ancient history); Robert Hymes (China, Japan, and Korea up to 1900); Graham Irwin (Africa); Gari Ledyard (China, Japan, and Korea up to 1900); Robert M. Levine (Latin America); Edward Malefakis (Spain, Portugal, Italy, and Greece since 1500); Daniel A. Metraux (Japan and the Pacific Rim since 1900); David Northrup (Africa); Alex Roland (military history); James P. Shenton (U.S. and Canadian history, 1860-1939); Reeva S. Simon (Middle East, North Africa, and Central Asia); Willem Smit (Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Holland, and Scandinavia since 1600); Martin Torodash (U.S. history up to 1860); Mark Von Hagen (Russia and East Europe); Isser Woloch (France, Belgium, and Luxembourg since 1500); Madeleine Zelin (China, Japan, and Korea since 1900).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in the life sciences for the fifth edition were: Sharon Akabas (food and nutrition); Ermelinda Bonaccio (anatomy and physiology); Douglas D. Daly (botany); Ellen C. Dierenfeld (food and nutrition); Stephen M. Factor (pathology); John D. Frame (medicine); John L. Gittleman (vertebrate zoology); Irving I. Gottesman (psychology and psychiatry); Eric Holtzman (cell biology, biochemistry, and genetics); William C. Kennard (agriculture); Jeffrey T. Laitman (anatomy and physiology); Mary C. Pearl (environmental studies and conservation); Kenneth Robinson (agriculture); Judith E. Winston (invertebrate zoology).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in geography for the fifth edition were: Robert Aageenbrug (Low Countries); Charles R. Bentley (polar regions); William Berentsen (Eastern Europe); Thomas D. Boswell (Mexico, Central America, and the Caribbean); John E. Brush (South Asia); Kenneth E. Corey (Japan and Korea); Daniel W. Gade (Spain and Portugal); Rowland Illick (Middle East); Victor Konrad (Canada); Gordon R. Lewthwaite (New Zealand); Ian R. Manners (Turkey, Greece, Cyprus, and Malta); Tom McKnight (Pacific Islands); Julian V. Minghi (France); Janice Monk (Australia); Peter O. Muller (United States); James L. Newman (Africa); Robert Ostergren (Scandinavia); Clifton W. Pannell (China); Neil Reid (Great Britain and Ireland); David J. Robinson (South America); Allan Rodgers (former Soviet Union, Baltic nations, and Italy); Robert Sinclair (Germany, Austria, and Switzerland); Richard Ulack (Southeast Asia).</p>
<p>Academic advisers in the physical sciences for the fifth edition were: Keith Barker (electrical engineering, computers, chemical engineering, and mining); Hyman Bass (mathematics); C. K. Chu (mechanical engineering, civil engineering, and aerospace); Gerald Feinberg (physics); Robert A. Gross (mechanical engineering, civil engineering, and aerospace); David Helfand (astronomy); Robert M. Kennedy (general and organic chemistry); H. E. Meadows (electrical engineering, computers, chemical engineering, and mining); John Mutter (earth sciences); Gerard Parkin (inorganic chemistry, metallurgy, and crystallography); Erick J. Weinberg (physics).</p><hr width="65%" align="center"/><p align="center" class="source"><i>The Columbia Electronic Encyclopedia,</i> 6th ed. Copyright 2012, Columbia University Press. Licensed from Columbia University Press. All rights reserved.</p><!-- google_ad_section_end -->

</div>
</td>

		</ul>
	</li>

	<li class="last"><a href="/states.html">The Fifty States</a></li>

<h1>Dictionary</h1>

<td class="ipBlockContent">

<p class="overview">Dictionary Search gives you access to more than 125,000 entries,
from <a href="http://dictionary.infoplease.com/aalii">aalii</a> to <a
        href="http://dictionary.infoplease.com/zymurgy">zymurgy</a>.</p>

>Writing &amp; Language</a
></div
><h1
id="A0001600"
class="level1"
>A Concise Guide to Grammar and Style</h1
>

<p>This concise guide to grammar and style will help you quickly review rules of capitalization, punctuation, forms of address, and italicization.  It's also a great tool for children to learn grammar rules.</p>
<!--BodyText--><table

+ ".scorecardresearch.com/beacon.js";el.parentNode.insertBefore(s, el);
})();
 </script>
<!-- End comScore Tag --><!-- SPRINGBOARD SLIDING VIDEO UNIT -->
<script>
var sbGlideScriptElement = document.createElement("script");
sbGlideScriptElement.type = "text/javascript";
sbGlideScriptElement.onload = function() {
    var glideUnit = typeof SbSlidingUnit == 'undefined' ? parent.SbSlidingUnit : SbSlidingUnit;
    glideUnit.init({
        partnerId : 4175,
        widgetId : 'info003',
        cmsPath : 'http://cms.springboardplatform.com'
    });
};
sbGlideScriptElement.src = "http://www.springboardplatform.com/storage/js/sliding/sliding_unit.js";
if (top === self)
	document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
else
	parent.document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(sbGlideScriptElement);
</script>
</head>

<div
class="context noindex"
><a
href="/sci.html"
>Health and Science</a
> > <a
href="A0004636.html"
>Inventions and Discoveries</a
></div
><h1 id="A0004637"
class="ftitile"
>A Guide to Inventions and Discoveries From Adrenaline to the Zipper </h1
>
<h2 class="fsubtitle">From Adrenaline to the Zipper</h2>
<h6></h6>
<!--BodyText--><p
> <i
>See also</i
> <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0004537"
>Famous Firsts in Aviation</a
>, <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0002158"
>Nobel Prizes</a
>.</p
><dl
id="A0005822"
class="nobull"
><dt
id="A0902567"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0817497"
>Adrenaline</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(isolation of) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0802114"
>John Jacob Abel</a
>, U.S., 1897.</dd
><dt
id="A0902568"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0802627"
>Aerosol can</a
>:</dt
><dd
>Erik Rotheim, Norway, 1926.</dd
><dt
id="A0902569"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0310684"
>Air brake</a
>:</dt
><dd
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0851933"
>George Westinghouse</a
>, U.S., 1868.</dd
><dt
id="A0902570"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0802888"
>Air conditioning</a
>:</dt
><dd
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0767112"
>Willis Carrier</a
>, U.S., 1911.</dd
><dt
id="A0902571"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0802908"
>Airship</a
>:</dt
><dd
> (non-rigid) Henri Giffard, France, 1852; (rigid) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0853359"
>Ferdinand von Zeppelin</a
>, Germany, 1900.</dd
><dt
id="A0902572"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0803542"
>Aluminum manufacture</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(by electrolytic action) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0767148"
>Charles M. Hall</a
>, U.S., 1866.</dd
><dt
id="A0902573"
>Anatomy, human:</dt
><dd
>(<i
>De fabrica corporis humani,</i
> an illustrated systematic study of the human body) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0850753"
>Andreas Vesalius</a
>, Belgium, 1543; (comparative: parts of an organism are correlated to the functioning whole) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0814364"
>Georges Cuvier</a
>, France, 1799&#8211;1805.</dd
><dt
id="A0902574"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0317343"
>Anesthetic</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(first use of anesthetic&mdash;ether&mdash;on humans) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0830218"
>Crawford W. Long</a
>, U.S., 1842.</dd
><dt
id="A0902575"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0804210"
>Antibiotics</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(first demonstration of antibiotic effect) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0837811"
>Louis Pasteur</a
>, Jules-Fran&#xE7;ois Joubert, France, 1887; (discovery of penicillin, first modern antibiotic) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0818904"
>Alexander Fleming</a
>, Scotland, 1928; (penicillin's infection-fighting properties) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0818961"
>Howard Florey</a
>, <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0811220"
>Ernst Chain</a
>, England, 1940.</dd
><dt
id="A0902576"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0804274"
>Antiseptic</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(surgery) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0829958"
>Joseph Lister</a
>, England, 1867.</dd
><dt
id="A0902577"
>Antitoxin, diphtheria:</dt
><dd
> <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0806791"
>Emil von Behring</a
>, Germany, 1890.</dd
><dt
id="A0902578"
>Appliances, electric:</dt
><dd
>(fan) Schuyler Wheeler, U.S., 1882; (flatiron) Henry W. Seely, U.S., 1882; (stove) Hadaway, U.S., 1896; (washing machine) Alva Fisher, U.S., 1906.</dd
><dt
id="A0902579"
>Aqualung:</dt
><dd
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0813824"
>Jacques-Yves Cousteau</a
>, Emile Gagnan, France, 1943.</dd
><dt
id="A0902580"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0805047"
>Aspirin</a
>:</dt
><dd
>Dr. Felix Hoffman, Germany, 1899.</dd
><dt
id="A0902783"
>Astronomical calculator:</dt
><dd
>The Antikythera device, Greece, first century <span
class="small"
>B.C.</span
>. Found off island of Antikythera in 1900.</dd
><dt
id="A0902784"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0805227"
>Atom</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(nuclear model of) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0842761"
>Ernest Rutherford</a
>, England, 1911.</dd
><dt
id="A0902786"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0327419"
>Atomic structure</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(formulated nuclear model of atom, Rutherford model) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0842761"
>Ernest Rutherford</a
>, England, 1911; (proposed current concept of atomic structure, the Bohr model) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0808132"
>Niels Bohr</a
>, Denmark, 1913.</dd
><dt
id="A0902785"
><a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0905226"
>Atomic theory</a
>:</dt
><dd
>(ancient) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0829535"
>Leucippus</a
>, <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0815131"
>Democritus</a
>, Greece, c. 500 <span
class="small"
>B.C.</span
>; <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0830558"
>Lucretius</a
>, Rome c.100 <span
class="small"
>B.C.</span
>; (modern) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0814542"

><dd
>(first paper negative, first photograph, on metal) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0835643"
>Joseph Nic&eacute;phore Niepce</a
>, France, 1816&#8211;1827; (discovery of fixative powers of hyposulfite of soda) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0858621"
>Sir John Herschel</a
>, England, 1819; (first direct positive image on silver plate, the daguerreotype) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0814484"
>Louis Daguerre</a
>, based on work with Niepce, France, 1839; (first paper negative from which a number of positive prints could be made) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0847692"
>William Talbot</a
>, England, 1841. Work of these four men, taken together, forms basis for all modern photography. (First color images) <a
href="/cgi-bin/id/A0806696"
>Alexandre Becquerel</a
>, Claude Niepce de Saint-Victor, France, 1848&#8211;1860; (commercial color film with three emulsion layers, Kodachrome) U.S., 1935.</dd

href="/cgi-bin/id/A0851376"
>Wallpaper</a
>:</dt
><dd
>Europe, 16th and 17th century.</dd

id="A0902775"

>:</dt

> (for syphilis) August von Wassermann, Germany, 1906.</dd

<div id="fCONTENT">

<!--BodyText-->

<h1>About Infoplease.com</h1>

<p><a href="aboutip-radio.html">Radio Show</a> | <a href="aboutip-almanac.html">Information Please Almanacs</a> | <a href="aboutip-internet.html">Internet</a></p>

<img src="//i.infopls.com/images/about-infoplease-reference-site.jpg" alt="About Infoplease.com"/>

<p>Information Please has been providing authoritative answers to all kinds of factual questions since 1938&#x2014;first as a popular radio quiz show, then starting in 1947 as an annual almanac, and since 1998 on the Internet at <a href="/index.html">www.infoplease.com</a>. Many things have changed since 1938, but not our dedication to providing reliable information, in a way that engages and entertains.</p>

<p>Parents, teachers and librarians turn to Infoplease.com for factual information on an array of topics, including current events, pop culture, science, government and history. They can confidently point students and children to the site, assured that it’s a safe place for kids to explore. The content is written and edited by experts, not users. We appreciate that you trust us to answer your questions and help educate your children.</p>


<!--/BodyText-->

<div id="tos">

<h1>Terms of Use: <span class="smaller">(Revised 1/2016)</span></h1>

<p>Agreement with Terms and Conditions: This agreement ("Agreement") sets forth the terms and conditions that apply to you ("Visitor"), an individual accessing the family of websites ("FEN Sites") of FEN, a division of Sandbox Networks, Inc. ("FEN"). By accessing the FEN Sites, you agree to the following terms and conditions and the <a href="http://fen.com/resources/privacyStatement.html">Privacy Statement</a>. If you do not agree, you have no right or license to access any part of the FEN Sites and you should not do so.<br>
<b>Changes in Terms and Conditions: </b><br>
FEN has the right to change or discontinue any aspect or feature of any FEN Site, including, but not limited to, content, hours of availability, and equipment needed for access or use, at any time. FEN has the right to change or modify the terms and conditions applicable to Visitor's use of any FEN Site, or any part thereof, or to impose new conditions, including, but not limited to, adding fees and charges for use at any time. Such changes, modifications, additions or deletions shall be effective immediately upon notice thereof, which may be given by means including, but not limited to, posting on the FEN Sites, or by electronic or conventional mail, or by any other means by which Visitor obtains notice thereof. Any use of the FEN Sites by Visitor subsequent to such notice shall be deemed to constitute acceptance by Visitor of such changes, modifications or additions.</p>


<p><b>Conduct of Visitor:</b></p>


<p><b>Lawful Use:</b><br>
Visitor shall use the FEN Sites for lawful purposes only. Visitor shall not post or transmit through any FEN Site any material which: (i) violates or infringes in any way upon the rights of others; (ii) is unlawful, threatening, abusive, defamatory, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, vulgar, obscene, profane or otherwise objectionable; (iii) encourages conduct that would constitute a criminal offense, gives rise to civil liability or otherwise violates any law; or (iv) contains advertising or any solicitation with respect to products or services, unless FEN has expressly approved such material in advance of its transmission. Any conduct by a Visitor that in FEN's discretion restricts or inhibits any other Visitor from using or enjoying any FEN Site is expressly prohibited.</p>


<p><b>Downloading of Intellectual Property: </b><br>
The FEN Sites contain copyrighted material, trademarks and other proprietary information, including, but not limited to, text, software, photos, video, graphics, music, and sound, portions of which are owned by FEN and portions of which are owned by other parties and licensed to FEN. The entire contents of the FEN Sites are copyrighted as a collective work/compilation. FEN owns copyright in the selection, coordination, arrangement, and enhancement of such content, as well as in the content original to it. No Visitor may modify, publish, transmit, participate in the transfer or sale, create derivative works, or in any way exploit, any of the content, in whole or in part. Except as otherwise expressly permitted under copyright law, no copying, redistribution, retransmission, publication or commercial exploitation of downloaded material will be permitted without the express written permission of FEN (or the copyright owner(s) if other than or in addition to FEN). In the event of any permitted copying, redistribution or publication of copyrighted material, no changes in or deletion of author attribution, trademark legend, copyright or other proprietary notice shall be made. Visitor acknowledges that he/she does not acquire any ownership rights by downloading copyrighted material. </p>


<p><b>Uploading of Intellectual Property: </b><br>
Visitor shall not upload, post or otherwise make available on any FEN Site any material protected by copyright, trademark, or other proprietary right, without the express written permission of the owner of the copyright, trademark, or other proprietary right, and the burden of determining that any material is not protected by copyright rests with Visitor. Visitor shall be solely liable for any damage resulting from any infringement of copyrights, proprietary rights, or any other harm resulting from such a submission. By submitting material to any public area of any FEN Site, Visitor automatically grants, or warrants that the owner of such material has expressly granted, FEN the royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, non-exclusive right and license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate and distribute such material (in whole or in part) worldwide and/or to incorporate it in other works in any form, media or technology now known or hereafter developed for the full term of any copyright that may exist in such material. Visitor also permits any other Visitor to access, view, store or reproduce the material for that Visitor's personal use. Visitor hereby grants FEN the right to edit, copy, publish and distribute any material made available on any FEN Site by Visitor. </p>


<p><b>Trademarks: </b><br>
Unless otherwise indicated, trademarks that appear on this site are trademarks of FEN or its affiliates. All other trademarks not owned by FEN or its affiliates that appear on this site are the property of their respective owners, who may or may not be affiliated with, connected to, or sponsored by FEN or its affiliates. </p>


<p><b>Postings: </b></p>


<p><b>No Responsibility or Liability: </b><br>
To the extent that portions of the FEN Sites (such as comments sections on blog posts  or message boards or share buttons for third party social media services, such as Facebook, Pinterest and Add This) provide users an opportunity to post and exchange information, ideas and opinions on FEN Sites or third party sites ("Postings"), BE ADVISED THAT FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK DOES NOT SCREEN, EDIT, OR REVIEW POSTINGS PRIOR TO THEIR APPEARANCE ON ANY FEN SITE OR ANY THIRD PARTY SITE, and Postings do not necessarily reflect the views of FEN. To the fullest extent permitted by applicable laws, FEN shall in no event have any responsibility or liability for the Postings or for any claims, damages, or losses resulting from their use and/or appearance on any FEN Site or any third party site. Please note that third party sites and social media services have their own terms of use and privacy policies and Visitors should be aware of them. </p>


<p><b>Monitoring: </b><br>
FEN reserves the right to monitor all Postings and to remove from a FEN Site any Posting which FEN considers in its absolute discretion to be offensive or otherwise in breach of these terms and conditions. </p>


<p><b>Warrant that You Have All Necessary Rights: </b><br>
You hereby represent and warrant that you have all necessary rights in and to all Postings you provide and all material they contain; that your Postings shall not infringe any proprietary or other rights of third parties; that your Postings shall not contain any viruses or other contaminating or destructive devices or features; that your Postings shall not contain any defamatory, indecent, offensive, tortious, or otherwise unlawful material or content; and that your Postings shall not be used to carry out or solicit any unlawful activity and/or be used to make commercial solicitations. </p>


<p><b>Authorize Others to Use: </b><br>
You hereby authorize FEN to use and/or authorize others to use all or part of your Postings in any manner, format, or medium that FEN or such other parties see fit. You shall have no claim or other recourse against FEN for infringement of any proprietary right in Postings. </p>


<p><b>Disclaimers and Limitation of Liability: </b></p>


<p><b>Use Is At Visitor's Risk: </b><br>
VISITOR EXPRESSLY AGREES THAT USE OF THE FEN SITES IS AT VISITOR'S OWN RISK. VISITOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROTECTING THE CONFIDENTIALITY OF VISITOR'S PASSWORD(S), IF ANY. NEITHER FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK, ITS AFFILIATES, NOR ANY OF THEIR RESPECTIVE EMPLOYEES, SHAREHOLDERS, AGENTS, THIRD-PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS OR LICENSORS, WARRANT THAT THE FEN SITES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR FREE; NOR DO THEY MAKE ANY WARRANTY AS TO THE RESULTS THAT MAY BE OBTAINED FROM USE OF ANY FEN SITE, OR AS TO THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY OR CONTENT OF ANY INFORMATION, SERVICE, OR MERCHANDISE PROVIDED THROUGH ANY FEN SITE. PRICE INFORMATION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE WITHOUT NOTICE. IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO EVALUATE THE ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS OF ALL INFORMATION, OPINIONS AND OTHER MATERIAL ON THE FEN SITES OR ANY SITES WITH WHICH IT IS LINKED. FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK PROVIDES TECHNOLOGY AUTOMATICALLY PRODUCING SEARCH RESULTS THAT LINK AND/OR REFERENCE SITES AND INFORMATION LOCATED WORLDWIDE THROUGHOUT THE INTERNET. BECAUSE WE HAVE NO CONTROL OVER SUCH SITES AND INFORMATION, FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK MAKES NO GUARANTEE AS TO SUCH SITES AND INFORMATION, INCLUDING THE ACCURACY, CURRENCY, CONTENT OR QUALITY OF ANY SUCH SITES AND INFORMATION AND FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK ASSUMES NO RESPONSIBILITY AS TO WHETHER THE SEARCH LOCATES UNINTENDED OR OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT. FURTHERMORE, BECAUSE SOME CONTENT ON THE INTERNET CONSISTS OF MATERIAL THAT IS ADULT-ORIENTED OR OTHERWISE OBJECTIONABLE TO SOME PEOPLE, THE RESULTS OF YOUR SEARCH ON OUR SITES MAY AUTOMATICALLY AND UNINTENTIONALLY GENERATE LINKS OR REFERENCES TO OBJECTIONABLE MATERIAL. WE MAKE NO CLAIM THAT SUCH SURPRISES MIGHT NOT OCCUR. </p>


<p><b>No Warranties of Service: </b><br>
THE FEN SITES ARE PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, WARRANTIES OF TITLE OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OTHER THAN THOSE WARRANTIES WHICH ARE INCAPABLE OF EXCLUSION, RESTRICTION OR MODIFICATION UNDER THE LAWS APPLICABLE TO THIS AGREEMENT. </p>


<p><b>Disclaimer of Liability: </b><br>
THIS DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY APPLIES TO ANY DAMAGES OR INJURY CAUSED BY ANY FAILURE OF PERFORMANCE, ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, DELETION, DEFECT, DELAY IN OPERATION OR TRANSMISSION, COMPUTER VIRUS, COMMUNICATION LINE FAILURE, THEFT OR DESTRUCTION OR UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO, ALTERATION OF, OR USE OF RECORD, WHETHER FOR BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORTIOUS BEHAVIOR, NEGLIGENCE, OR UNDER ANY OTHER CAUSE OF ACTION. VISITOR SPECIFICALLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK AND ITS LICENSORS ARE NOT LIABLE FOR THE DEFAMATORY, OFFENSIVE OR ILLEGAL CONDUCT OF OTHER VISITORS OR THIRD PARTIES AND THAT THE RISK OF INJURY FROM THE FOREGOING RESTS ENTIRELY WITH VISITOR. </p>


<p><b>Visitor's Waiver of Damages: </b><br>
IN NO EVENT WILL FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK, OR ANY PERSON OR ENTITY INVOLVED IN CREATING, PRODUCING OR DISTRIBUTING ANY PART OF THE FEN SITES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF OR INABILITY TO USE ANY PART OF THE FEN SITES. VISITOR HEREBY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY TO ALL CONTENT ON ALL FEN SITES.</p>


<p>IN ADDITION TO THE TERMS SET FORTH ABOVE, NEITHER FAMILY EDUCATION NETWORK, NOR ITS AFFILIATES, INFORMATION PROVIDERS OR CONTENT PARTNERS SHALL BE LIABLE REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OR DURATION, FOR ANY ERRORS, INACCURACIES, OMISSIONS, OR OTHER DEFECTS IN, OR UNTIMELINESS OR UNAUTHENTICITY OF, THE INFORMATION CONTAINED WITHIN ANY FEN SITE, OR FOR ANY DELAY OR INTERRUPTION IN THE TRANSMISSION THEREOF TO THE VISITOR, OR FOR ANY CLAIMS OR LOSSES ARISING THEREFROM OR OCCASIONED THEREBY. NONE OF THE FOREGOING PARTIES SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY THIRD-PARTY CLAIMS OR LOSSES OF ANY NATURE, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOST PROFITS, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES. </p>


<p><b>Indemnification: </b><br>
Visitor agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless FEN, its affiliates and their respective directors, officers, shareholders, employees, agents, and assigns from and against all claims and expenses, including attorneys' fees, arising out of Visitor's use of any FEN Site. </p>


<p><b>Email Newsletters: </b><br>
Please be advised that our email newsletters ("Newsletters") are part of a wide distribution, and that neither FEN nor any third party involved is monitoring, reviewing or screening the recipient email list prior to its distribution. The Newsletters are distributed only to those who have expressly opted-in to receive them. If local, state or federal rules or regulations prohibit the recipient from receiving these types of Newsletters or the recipient simply does not wish to receive same in the future or the Newsletter was sent to recipient in error, the recipient should immediately opt-out from receiving similar future offers and/or newsletters by visiting the <a href="http://newsletters.fen.com/">FEN Newsletter Center</a> and updating his or her subscription. The recipient can always opt back in to receive future offers and/or newsletters at any time by going to the Newsletter Center. To review and modify the categories of offers and/or newsletters for opted-in, please go to <a href="http://newsletters.fen.com/">http://newsletters.fen.com. </a></p>


<p><b>Equipment for Visitor's Use:</b><br>
Visitor shall be responsible for obtaining and maintaining all telephones, computer hardware, and other equipment needed for access to and use of the FEN Sites and for any/all charges related thereto. </p>


<p><b>FEN Sites' Content: </b><br>
Certain content portions of the FEN Sites are supplied by third parties. Any opinions, advice, statements, services, offers, or other information or content expressed or made available by third parties, including information providers, are those of the respective author(s) or distributor(s) and not of FEN. Neither FEN nor any third-party provider of information guarantees the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of any content, nor its merchantability or fitness for any particular purpose. FEN neither endorses nor is responsible for the accuracy or reliability of any opinion, advice or statement made on any FEN Site by anyone other than employee spokespersons of FEN while acting in their official capacities. </p>


<p><b>Submissions: </b><br>
FEN always welcomes suggestions and comments regarding any FEN Sites. Any comments or suggestions submitted to FEN Sites or FEN, either online or offline, will become FEN's property upon their submission. This policy is intended to avoid the possibility of future misunderstandings when projects developed by FEN might seem to others to be similar to their own submissions or comments. </p>


<p><b>Entire Agreement: </b><br>
This Agreement, and any operating rules for the FEN Sites established by FEN, constitutes the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes all previous written or oral agreements between the parties with respect to such subject matter. </p>


<p><b>Controlling Law: </b><br>
This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, without regard to its conflict of laws rules. Any cause of action of any nature arising out this Agreement shall be brought in the City and County of New York. </p>


<p><b>Headings: </b><br>
The section headings used herein are for convenience only and shall not be given any legal import whatsoever. </p>


<p><b>Digital Millennium Copyright Act Compliance: </b><br>
If you have copyright concerns about any materials posted on this site by others, please let us know. We comply with the provisions of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act applicable to Internet service providers (17 U.S.C. &#167; 512). If you have any complaints or objections to material posted on this site, please contact our Designated Agent ("Notice"):</p>


<p><b>Designated Agent</b><br> 
Family Education Network<br>
                              50 Congress Street, Suite 1025<br>
                              Boston, MA 02109</p>


<p>Or, you can <a href="mailto:designated.agent@fen.com?subject=DMCA Agent Request">click here</a> to email us about any copyright concerns about any materials posted on this site by others.</p>


<p>To be effective, the Notice must include the following:</p>


<ul>
  <li>A physical or electronic signature of the owner or a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner ("Complaining Party") of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed;</li>
  <li>Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed, or if multiple copyrighted works at a single FEN Site are covered by a single notification, a representative list of such works at that site; </li>
  <li>Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit FEN to locate the material; </li>
  <li>Information reasonably sufficient to permit FEN to contact the Complaining Party, such as an address, telephone number, and if available, an electronic mail address at which the Complaining Party may be contacted; </li>
  <li>A statement that the Complaining Party has a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and</li>
  <li>A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that the Complaining Party is the owner or is authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. </li>
</ul>

<!--=== CONTENT AREA ===-->
<td valign="top">

<div style="margin:20px 0 0 20px;width:503px;">


<h1>PRIVACY STATEMENT (1/2016)</h1>

<p>FEN, a division of Sandbox Networks, Inc., ("FEN") operates this website ("Website") and is committed to protecting the privacy and security of its online visitors. We are also extremely sensitive to family and educator concerns about children's safety and information related to them. We want you to know about and understand the measures we have taken to keep the websites and online services provided by FEN a safe and secure environment for everyone. This privacy statement tells you about the types of information that we collect from you, how we collect that information from you and how we use that information.  </p>

<p>We encourage our visitors to read through and understand our privacy statement. We may update it from time to time to address new issues or reflect changes on our Website. Please refer to this privacy statement regularly.  FEN reserves the right to revise this privacy statement at any time and such revisions shall be effective immediately upon notice thereof. Notice may be given by any means including, but not limited to, posting the revised privacy statement on this Website. Any use of our site by you subsequent to such notice shall be deemed to constitute acceptance by you of such revision. </p>

<p>If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy statement, or your dealings with FEN, please: </p>

<p>a)  E-mail us at <a href="http://fen.custhelp.com/app/ask/p/1/search/1">Customer Support</a>; </p>

<p>b)  Write to us at: FEN, 50 Congress St, Suite 1025, Boston, MA 02109; or</p>

<p>c)  Call us at: 1-800-498-3264. </p>


<h2>Information We Collect From You</h2>

<p>When you use this Website, we may collect personal information and anonymized information from you.  Personal information means information that would identify you, directly or indirectly, such as your name, mailing address, email address or telephone number.  Anonymized information means information that does not or could not reasonably be used to identify a specific individual. </p>

<p>When you create a user account we may request that you create a unique username and password and provide us with certain personal information, such as, first name, last name, email address, gender, date of birth, and ZIP code. </p>

<p>In connection with a purchase transaction, we will ask you for the following information: first name, last name, billing zip code or postal code, phone number, credit card number, security code, and card expiration date. </p>

<p>This Website may contain blogs, bulletin boards or other public forums where free form entry is permitted.  We highly recommend that you do not post your personal information when using these features.   If you provide your personal information through any of these features, then such personal information will be posted publicly.  </p>

<p>We also collect anonymized information from your computer or device such as browser type, operating system, referring pages, pages visited, time spent on a particular page and IP address.  </p>


<h2>How We Collect Your Information </h2>


<p>When you use this website, we collect personal information and anonymized information through a variety of methods. </p>

<p>We collect personal information from you when you interact with this Website by filling out a form such as registering for a user account, submitting a customer service request, conducting a purchase transaction, or participating in a public discussion forum. </p>

<p>We collect anonymized information from you by using technologies like cookies, web beacons and server logs.  </p>

<p>This Website contains cookies from FEN and third parties.  While browsing through this Website, you may get cookies from our advertisers or sponsors. FEN does not control these cookies. </p>


<h2>How We Use Your Information</h2>

<p>FEN and its affiliates may use your personal information to tailor the content programming, services, and applications that we provide to meet your needs and interests. When you conduct a purchase transaction through this Website, you are providing purchase transaction information to FEN's third party service providers (such as transaction processors and financial institutions) who will use the information solely for the purpose of the purchase transaction.   </p>

<p>When visitors request pages from FEN sites, our servers log users' IP addresses. We typically do not link IP addresses to any personal information. This means that a visitor's session will be logged, but the visitor remains anonymous to us. </p>

<p>FEN collects IP addresses for system administration, to report aggregate information to our advertisers, sponsors, and partners, and to audit the use of our site.  We will use IP addresses to identify a user in the following situations: (a) in response to subpoenas, court orders or legal process, to the extent permitted and as restricted by law; (b) when disclosure is required to maintain the security and integrity of this site, or to protect any user's security or the security of other persons, consistent with applicable laws. </p>

<p>The anonymized information we track with cookies is not used to identify, or lead us back to, any particular visitor. Visitors to this Website may have the option of disabling cookies via their browser preferences (most browsers are initially set up to accept cookies).  Cookies make our Website easier for you to use because they save your preferences while you are visiting our sites (although we do not save passwords in cookies). Cookies also help us know which areas are your favorites, which areas need improvement, and what technologies and Internet services our visitors are using. Knowing this information helps us continually improve the online experience for our visitors and members. </p>

<p>FEN may also use third party vendors who supply applications, web hosting and other technologies for this Website that may have access to your personal information and anonymized information but they will never use such information for any other purpose except to provide services in connection with this site. </p> 

<p>FEN will not share any personal information about you with any third party (a party not affiliated with Sandbox Networks, Inc.), except as otherwise stated in this Privacy Statement and in the following circumstances: (a) in response to subpoenas, court orders or legal process, to the extent permitted and as restricted by law; (b) when disclosure is required to maintain the security and integrity of this site, or to protect any user's security or the security of other persons, consistent with applicable laws; (c) when disclosure is directed or consented to by the registered member who has inputted the personal information; (d) in the event that Sandbox Networks, Inc. (the owner of FEN) or any of its subdivisions or units goes through a business transition, such as a merger, divestiture, acquisition, liquidation or sale of all or a portion of its assets, your personal information will, in most instances, be part of the assets transferred; or (e) in limited circumstances, FEN may disclose your email address in order to comply with laws and regulations, including the Controlling the Assault of Non-Solicited Pornography and Marketing Act (CAN-SPAM of 2003). </p>

<h2>Helpful Explanations</h2>

<p>An IP address is a number that is assigned automatically to your computer whenever you use the World Wide Web. Web servers -- the big computers that "serve up" Web pages -- automatically identify your computer by its IP address.  </p>

<p>The use of "cookies" is common in the Internet industry; you will find them used on this Website, as you will at other major websites. "Cookies" are small text files written to your computer.  For more information about cookies please go to: <a href="http://www.allaboutcookies.org/">http://www.allaboutcookies.org/</a>.</p>


<h2>Children's Privacy</h2>

<p>We do not knowingly contact or collect personal information from children under 13 through this Website. If you believe we have inadvertently collected such information, please contact us so we can promptly remove the information. </p>

<h2>About Our Advertisers:</h2>

<p>This Website allows advertising by third parties. FEN does not control the linking practices of advertisers or sponsors and does not monitor or claim responsibility for any content or privacy practices of such websites. Once you have clicked on an advertisement and have left this Website, you must read the privacy policy of the advertiser or sponsor to see how your personal information will be handled. </p>

<p>FEN may offer contests, sweepstakes, and promotions that are sponsored by third-party advertisers or sponsors. These third parties may obtain personally identifiable information that visitors voluntarily submit to participate in the activity. FEN does not control the third parties' use of information. </p>

<p>FEN may use advertising servers developed by third parties to display ads on this Website. Some of these ads may contain cookies that are set by third parties (advertisers, sponsors) and may use anonymized information (not including your name, address, email address, telephone number) about your visits to this and other sites in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you. We do not have access to these cookies or any information that they transmit. The FEN privacy statement does not cover any use of information that a third-party ad server may have collected from you. 
For more information on ad serving, please go to: <a href="http://www.allaboutcookies.org/ad-serving/">http://www.allaboutcookies.org/ad-serving/</a>. If you would like to know your choices about not having information used by these third parties, please go to: <a href="http://www.networkadvertising.org/understanding-online-advertising/what-are-my-options. ">http://www.networkadvertising.org/understanding-online-advertising/what-are-my-options</a>. </p>


<h2>A Notice About External Links</h2>

<p>Occasionally, you will find links from FEN to independently owned, controlled, and/or managed Websites whose content we believe will be of possible interest and value to our visitors. Additionally, you'll see links from advertisers, sponsors, and other partners who may use a FEN owned logo as part of a co-branding agreement.

<p>In many cases, these links represent cooperative projects or mutual links established with the organizations connected with these sites. We do not control the content of these links. These other sites may send you their own cookies, collect data, or solicit personal information. While we identify sponsor and advertiser areas of our Websites, we do not control these cookies or the content of these third parties. </p>

<p>FEN has partnered with other companies to provide certain services. In some cases, you may see a FEN owned logo on another company's site. FEN does not share any of your personally identifiable information with these partners and they do not share any information with us. </p>

<p>Once you leave our servers (you can generally tell where you are by checking the URL in the location bar on your browser), the use of any information collected from you is governed by the privacy policy of the operator of the site you are visiting. That policy may differ from ours. If you cannot find the privacy policy of any of these sites via a link from that site's Home page, you should contact the site directly for more information. </p>

<p>We specifically recommend that children check with their parents, guardians, or teachers before connecting to any new sites. </p>


<h2>Security, Purchases and Credit Card Use: </h2>

<p>FEN has security measures in place to protect the loss, misuse, and alteration of the information under our control. Essentially, we encrypt all transmission of sensitive data and secure all of our repositories of data. When you use your credit card to make a purchase transaction with FEN, your transaction is secure. Our servers use encryption technology to safeguard your personal information and privacy. However, you should understand that "perfect security" cannot be guaranteed.</p>

<h2>Analytics Tools We Use</h2>


<p>We are committed to ensuring that the Website is valuable and useful to our users. To assist us in this, we have implemented the Google, Inc.'s Google Analytics demographics and interest reporting features on the Website. These tools allow us to review anonymous data regarding the gender, age and interests of Website visitors and collect and analyze certain types of information, including cookies, IP addresses, device and software identifiers, referring and exit URLs, feature use metrics and statistics, usage and purchase history, MAC Address, mobile unique device ID, and other similar information, all to adapt the Website to better reflect our users' needs. Although this information is collected through your Google ad settings, it is not provided to us in a personally-identifiable format. This means we cannot identify what information is about you, and we will not try to figure it out.</p>

<p>The Google Analytics demographics and interest reporting features may collect information on the Website and other online or mobile products and/or services and may combine the information collected with other information Google has independently collected from other websites and/or other online or mobile products and services relating to your activities across their network of websites as well as online and/or mobile products and services. Google collects and uses information under its own privacy policies. Google utilizes the data collected to track and examine the use of this Website, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network.</p>

<p>The Google Analytics demographics and interest reporting features tool uses "cookies" which are text files placed on your computer, to collect standard internet log information and visitor behavior information in an anonymous form. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the Website (including IP address) is transmitted to Google. This information is then used to evaluate visitors' use of the Website and to compile statistical reports on Website activity.</p>

<p>You may opt out of Google Advertising by visiting the <a href="http://www.google.com/policies/technologies/ads">Google advertising opt-out page</a> or you may opt out of Google Analytics by visiting the <a href="http://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout">Google Analytics opt-out page</a>.</p>

<p>Google has additional information available about their <a href="http://adwords.google.com/support/aw/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=100746">Remarketing Privacy Guidelines</a>, and Restrictions.</p>

<p>You may view a list of other third party service providers who collect information, and/or opt-out of such collection of information about you, by visiting <a href="http://www.networkadvertising.org/choices/">http://www.networkadvertising.org/choices/</a> or <a href="http://www.aboutads.info/choices/">http://www.aboutads.info/choices/</a>.</p>

<P>Use of Intercom Services: We use third-party analytics services to help understand your usage of the Site. In particular, we provide a limited amount of information on our users (such as email address and sign-up date) to Intercom, Inc. ("Intercom") and utilize Intercom to collect user data for analytics purposes. Intercom analyzes usage of the Site and tracks FEN's relationship with you so we can improve your experience on the Site. We also use Intercom as a medium for communications with you, either through email, or through messages within the Site. As part of FEN's service agreement with Intercom, Intercom collects publicly available contact and social information related to our users, such as email address, gender, company, job title, photos, website URLs, social network handles and physical addresses, also to enhance such your experience on the Site. For more information on the privacy practices of Intercom, please visit <a href="https://docs.intercom.io/pricing-and-terms/privacy">http://docs.intercom.io/privacy</a>. Intercom's services are governed by Intercom's terms of use which can be found at <a href="https://docs.intercom.io/pricing-and-terms/terms">http://docs.intercom.io/terms</a>. You can always opt out of having such information collected by or submitted to Intercom by contact us and making such request in writing.</P>

</div>

<h1>Linking to Information Please</h1>

<p><b>You are welcome and encouraged to link from your web site to
Infoplease.</b> Please remember that much of the information on
Infoplease.com is protected by copyright, and you many not copy the
text or graphics found on Infoplease without permission and proper
attribution.</p>

<p><b>You may link to the the Infoplease home page or to any interior
page within the site.</b> And while we cannot promise that every URL
on the site will remain valid indefinitely, we do make every
reasonable effort to ensure that they do. In fact, while the site is
continually updated to ensure accuracy and currency of information,
most of the links found on the site when we started in 1998 remain
valid today.</p>

<p>You may not link to Infoplease from any site that displays
pornographic material, exploits children, provides instruction on or
promotes illegal activities, or is in any way misleading, obscene,
defamatory, libelous, or invasive of personal privacy.</p>

<p><b>You can create a free reference center on your site</b> by <a href="tools.html">adding an Infoplease search box</a>. Our powerful
search engine will give visitors to your site access to all the
reference material at Infoplease.</p>

<p>If you'd like to use our <b>logo</b> along with your Infoplease
link, first make sure you comply with our <a href="logoterms.html">Logo Agreement</a>, then choose a logo
below.</p>

<h2><a href="/homework/">Homework Center</a></h2>
<dl>

<div id="fCONTENT">

<!--BodyText-->

<h1>Advertising on Infoplease.com</h1>

<h6>&nbsp;</h6>

<p><a href="#ADV-about">About Infoplease.com</a> | <a href="#ADV-audience">Audience Demographics</a> | <a href="#ADV-context">Contextual Targeting/Customization</a> | <a href="#ADV-contact">Contact</a></p>



<h3 id="ADV-about">Why Infoplease.com?</h3>

<p>Users come to infoplease.com to feed their hunger for facts and information.</p>


<h3 id="ADV-about">About Infoplease.com</h3>


<h4>History</h4>

<p>Information Please began as a <a href="/aboutip.html?type=radio">famous 1930s hit radio show</a>, and went on to become one of America's premier almanacs. From 1947 through 1997 it was published annually under the title <em>The Information Please Almanac</em>; since 1998 it has been published by Time Magazine as <a href="/orderipa.html"><em>The TIME Almanac with Information Please</em></a>. In 1998, Infoplease.com was launched on the Web, and quickly became an authoritative and respected reference for Internet users.  The website is especially popular with students&mdash;as well as anyone looking for reliable, well-researched facts. Over 9 million visitors come to Infoplease.com for answers each month, viewing some 35 million pages of content.</p>

<h4>Infoplease.com contains:</h4>

<ul>
  <li>The <a href="/encyclopedia/">Columbia Encyclopedia</a>, a <a href="/dictionary.html">Random House Dictionary</a>, and a <a href="/thesaurus">thesaurus</a>.</li>

  <li>An <a href="/atlas/">atlas</a> with maps and detailed profiles of every <a href="/countries.html">country</a> and <a href="/states.html">U.S. state</a>.</li>

  <li>Daily features such as <a href="/dayinhistory">This Day in History</a>, <a href="/birthday">Today's Birthday</a>, and <a href="/wordoftheday">Word Quiz</a>.</li>

  <li><a href="/spot/timelinearchive.html">Timelines</a>, <a href="/quizzes/">quizzes</a>, and <a href="/spot/pollarchive.html">polls</a>, and "top ten" lists.</li>

  <li>Interactive features such as a <a href="/pages/unitconversion.html">"convert anything" tool</a> and a <a href="/periodictable.php">periodic table</a>.</li>

  <li>A <a href="/homework/">Homework Center</a> for students.</li>


<li>Timely features on current news, entertainment, and seasonal events.</li>

<li>Statistical tables and rankings  that are continuously updated.</li>


  <li>A powerful search tool that provides relevant results instantly.</li>
</ul>
		<h3 id="ADV-audience">Infoplease.com Audience Demographics</h3>
<p>Over 9 million unique visitors come to Infoplease.com each month.</p>
<p>Over 35 million pages are viewed each month.</p>
<p>Infoplease.com is heavily used by students, from high school through graduate school. </p>
<p>Site visitors are heavy purchasers of music, books, computers, and consumer electronics.</p>
<p>The audience is 52% female, 48% male.</p>

<ul><strong>Age Ranges</strong>
<li>15%	are younger than 18 years old.</li>
<li>25%	are 18&ndash;24 years old.</li>
<li>35%	are 25&ndash;44 years old.</li>
<li>15%	are 45&ndash; 64 years old.</li>
<li>10%	 are   65 or older.</li></ul>

<h3 id="ADV-context">Contextual Targeting/Customization</h3>

<p><strong>Ads can be targeted to pages with relevant content, including these verticals:</strong></p>
<ul>
  <li>Travel (<a href="/us.html">US</a>, <a href="/world.html">World</a>, <a href="/atlas/">Maps</a>)</li>
  <li><a href="/ent.html">Arts &amp; Entertainment</a></li>
  <li><a href="/bus.html">Business</a></li>
  <li><a href="/sci.html">Health & Science</a></li>
  <li><a href="/history.html">Government</a></li>
  <li><a href="/almanacs.html">Reference</a>/<a href="/edu/colleges/index.html">Education</a></li>
</ul>

<p><strong>We can create content to meet your advertising needs, or repurpose your existing content within Infoplease.com templates.</strong></p>

<h3 id="ADV-contact">Contact</h3>


<p><strong>Information Please / Fact Monster</strong><br />
If you are interested in advertising on Infoplease or Fact Monster or have any other advertising questions, please email <a href="mailto:advertise@fen.com?subject=Advertise Inquiry%20-%20FamilyEducation.com">advertise@fen.com</a><!--visit: <strong><a href="http://www.evolvemediallc.com/contact">Evolve Media</a></strong></p>

<font face="verdana, arial, helvetica" size=2 color="#3333cc"><b>For partner information, please <a href="http://fen.custhelp.com/app/ask/p/1234" target="_blank">contact us</a>.</b></font><br><br>


<!--BodyText-->
<font face="verdana, arial, helvetica" size=2>

<p>Infoplease.com is more than a valuable research tool and information destination. It is a tremendous partner for sites aiming to increase content without diluting focus or increasing personnel and overhead.</p>

<p>Infoplease.com's content can be easily integrated with partner sites to broaden and enhance existing offerings or to provide a complementary service to visitors. With a minimal amount of effort, the resources of infoplease.com can add significantly to traffic and corresponding revenue.</p>

</font>
</p>

<p><a NAME="ip"></a><font size=4 color="#000080"><b>Infoplease Partners</b></font><br>

<p><b>Magellan Geographix</b><br/>
<a href="http://www.maps.com">http://www.maps.com</a><br/>
The Maps channel on Infoplease features 345 maps from Magellan.  You can find maps for all the countries and regions of the world, plus a map for each of the fifty states. </p>

<h1 class="ftitle">Top TV Programs, 2013&ndash;2014 Season</h1>

<p>Find out which network television shows ranked in the top ten for the 2013&ndash;2014 season.</p>
<!--BodyText-->

<table id="A092111" border="1" class="sgmltable">

<td>21.528</td></tr> <tr><td>2 </td>

<td>CBS</td>
<td>19.960</td></tr> <tr><td>3 </td><td>NCIS </td><td>CBS </td>

    <div class="context noindex"><a
    href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a> &gt; <a
    href="A0147117.html">Movies and Videos</a></div>
   <div class="center">
    <h1 class="ftitle">Top 30 All-Time Box-Office Hits</h1>
</div>

      <!--BodyText-->
<p>The following table lists the top 30 highest grossing movies in the United States. As of June 1, 2015, <i>Avatar</i> was the biggest box-office hit of all-time.</p>

    <div class="center">
      <table border="1" class="sgmltable" id="A0302257">
        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="bottom">Rank</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top">Title/Year</td>

          <td align="right" valign="bottom">Domestic Gross*</td>
        </tr>
  <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">1.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Avatar</i> (2009)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">$760,507,625</td>
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">2.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Titanic</i> (1997)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">658,672,302</td>
        </tr>
 <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">3.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Avengers</i> (2012)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">623,357,910</td>
        </tr>
        
        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">4.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Dark Knight</i> (2008)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">534,858,444</td>
        </tr>
        
         <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">5.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Star Wars: Episode I—The Phantom
          Menace</i> (1999)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">474,544,249</td>
        </tr>
		  
		  <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">6.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Star Wars</i> (1977)<sup
          class="fnr">1</sup></td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">460,998,882</td>
        </tr>
 <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">7.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Dark Knight Rises</i> (2012)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">448,139,099</td>
        </tr>
 <tr>
   <td align="right" valign="top">8.</td>
   <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Avengers: Age of Ultron</i> (2015)</td>
   <td align="center" valign="top">445,228,711</td>
 </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">9.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Shrek 2</i> (2004)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">441,226,414</td>
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">10.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial</i>
          (1982)<sup class="fnr">1</sup></td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">435,110,890</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">11.</td>
          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Hunger Games: Catching Fire </i> (2013)</td>
          <td align="center" valign="top">$424,668,047</td>
        </tr>

       

        <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">12.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead
          Man's Chest</i> (2006)</td>
          
          

          <td align="center" valign="top">423,315,199</td>
        </tr>
         <tr>
          <td align="right" valign="top">13.</td>

          <td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Lion King</i> (1994)</td>

          <td align="center" valign="top">422,783,937</td>
        </tr>

<h1 class="ftitle">Highest Earning Dead Celebrities</h1>
    <!--BodyText-->

    <p>The following table lists the richest dead celebrities, according to <i>Forbes</i>. From pop icon Michael Jackson to famed inventor Albert Einstein, the money continues to roll into the coffers of these celebrities' estates.</p>
    <!-- right side table -->
    <table align="left" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="fRELATED" style="width:180px">
        <tbody><tr>
            <td>
                <img src="//i.infopls.com/images/michael-jackson-1984.jpg" width="150" height="225" border="0" alt="highest earning dead celebrity michael jackson performing in 1984" />
                <p class="imgCaption">Michael Jackson was the top earning dead celebrity in 2015<br />AP Photo/Doug Pizac, file</p></td>
        </tr>
        </tbody></table>

    <div class="left">
        <table border="1" class="sgmltable" id="A0004548">
            <tr>
                <th align="center" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</th>

                <th align="left" style="font-size:13px" valign="bottom">Celebrity</th>

                <th align="center" style="font-size:13px"
                    valign="bottom">Earnings<br />2015</th>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">1.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Michael Jackson</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$115 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">2.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Elvis Presley</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$55 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">3.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Charles Schulz</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$40 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">4.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Bob Marley</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$21 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">5.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Elizabeth Taylor</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$20 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">6.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Marilyn Monroe</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$17 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">7.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">John Lennon</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$12 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">8.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Albert Einstein</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$11 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">9.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Paul Walker</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$10.5 million</td>
            </tr>

            <tr>
                <td align="center" valign="top">10.</td>

                <td align="left" valign="top">Bettie Page</td>

                <td align="center" valign="top">$10 million</td>
            </tr>
        </table>

       <div class="note"><i>Source:</i> Forbes.com</div>
    </div>

    <br />

 <td align="left" width="190" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><img src="http://i.infopls.com/images/topten3.gif" width="190" height="22" border="0" hspace="0" vspace="0" alt="The Top Ten"></td>
 <td width="100%" align="right" valign="middle"><span class="synddate" style="padding-bottom:1px;">&nbsp;December 10 -  17&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></td>

  <body>
    <div align="center" class="syndhead">
      Wealthiest Fictional Characters
    </div>
	 
<p>This list&mdash;entirely subjective&mdash;bases the wealth of the characters on world events (Daddy Warbucks has clearly benefited from the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan), the economy (with gas prices reaching record levels, Jed Clampett is sitting pretty atop his reserves of black gold), and trends (Prince Abakaliki of Nigeria, a fictional character who could also be called the King of Spam, clogs the inboxes of millions of real people each day).</p>
	 
	 <!--******** end of TITLE ********-->

    "#99CCCC" align="center">

<div id='ssky'><div class='interior'><div id='ros_4545'></div></div></div><!-- -->

<ul class="list">

  	<li class="mobile-only"><a href="#" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" role="button" aria-expanded="false">Tools <span class="caret"></span></a>
		<ul class="dropdown-menu nav-links" role="menu">
			<li><a href="/math/calculator.html">Calculator</a></li>

</div> <!-- close topnav -->
         </div><!--navbar-collapse collapse-->
	</div><!-- container -->

<!--******** TITLE (appears at top of the page) ********-->
<div align=center class=syndhead>Highest-Earning Fictional Characters</div>
<!--******** end of TITLE ********-->

<p>The earnings are based on worldwide revenue related to toy merchandising, videogame sales, publishing and box-office earnings, and DVD/VHS sales and rentals.</p>



<!--******** MAIN TABLE with 3 columns ********-->
<table width=95% border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 bordercolor="#99cccc" align="center"><tr bgcolor="#99cccc"><td valign=top align=center><table align="center" border=0 cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 width=100%><tr><td align="left" bgcolor="#cccccc" border="0"><TABLE valign=top width=100% cellpadding=3 cellspacing=1 border=0 bgcolor="#cccccc">

    <div class="context noindex">
      
      <a href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a>

          </div>

    <h1 class="ftitle">The 10 Most Expensive Paintings Ever
    Sold</h1>
<P>Below is a list of the most expensive paintings sold. Price paid and year of purchase are included.</p>
    <!--BodyText-->

    <ol id="A0921838">
	
	<li>$300 million for <i>Nafea Faa Ipoipo (When Will You Marry?)</i> by <a
      href="/biography/var/paulgaugin.html">Paul Gauguin</a>      (2015)</li>
    <li>$250 million for <i>The Card Players</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0811185">Paul Cézanne</a>      (2011)</li>
      
       <li>$179.4 million for <i>Women of Algiers </i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0838929">Pablo Picasso</a> (2015)</li>
      <li>$155 million for <i>La R&ecirc;ve</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0838929">Pablo Picasso</a> (2013)</li>
      <li>$142.4 million for <i>Three Studies of Lucian Freud</i> by <a
      href="/encyclopedia/people/bacon-francis-english-painter.html">Francis Bacon </a>
      (2013)</li>
      <li>$140 million for <i>No. 5, 1948</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0839548">Jackson Pollock</a>      (2006)</li>

      <li>$137.5 million for <i>Woman III</i> by <a
      href="/ipa/A0197696.html">Willem de Kooning</a>      (2006)</li>

      <li>$135 million for <i>Adele Bloch-Bauer I</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0827898">Gustav Klimt</a> (2006)</li>
      
      <li>$119.9 million for <i>The Scream</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0834425">Edvard Munch</a> (2012)</li>
      
      <li>$110 million for <i>&quot;Flag&quot;</i> by <a
      href="/biography/var/jasperjohns.html">Jasper Johns</a> (2010)</li>
      
      <!--

<li>$106.5 million for <i>Nude, Green Leaves and Bust</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0838929">Pablo Picasso</a> (2010)</li>

      <li>$104 million for <i>Boy with a Pipe</i> by <a
      href="/cgi-bin/id/A0838929">Pablo Picasso</a> (2004)</li>

-->
      
     
           
    </ol>

    <br />

    

    
    <!--/BodyText-->

    <div class="context noindex">
      
      <a href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a>
          </div>

    <h1 class="ftitle">Top Ten Biggest Art Heists</h1>
<P>Here are the ten biggest art heists and the high-value paintings that were stolen. These pieces remain at large.</p>
    <!--BodyText-->
  <!-- right side table -->
  <table align="right" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="fRELATED" style="width:180px">
      <tbody><tr>
          <td>
              <img src="//i.infopls.com/images/gardner-museum-heist.jpg" width="250" height="311" border="0" alt="FBI reward poster" />
              <p class="imgCaption">AP Photo/FBI</p></td>
      </tr>
      </tbody></table>
    <div class="center">
        <table class="sgmltable centered" id="toptenartheists" border="1">
            <tbody>

            <tr>

                <th>Rank</th><th>Location </th><th>Painting and value</th><th>Total value of theft</th><th>Date</th></tr>

            <tr><td>1. </td>
                <td>Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Boston</td>
                <td>Johannes Vermeer, <i>The Concert</i>, $200 million</td><td>$500 million</td><td>March 18, 1990</td></tr>
            <tr><td>2.</td>
                <td>Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Boston, Mass.</td>
                <td>Rembrandt Van Rijn, <i>Storm of the Sea of Galilee</i> $3.4 million</td><td>$500 million</td><td>March 18, 1990</td></tr>
            <tr><td>3.</td>
                <td>Musee d'Art Moderne, Paris, France</td>
                <td>Pablo Picasso,<i> Le Pigeon Aux Petits Pois</i> or <i>The Pigeon With Green Peas</i>, $30 million</td><td>$140 million</td><td>May 20, 2010</td></tr>
            <tr><td>4.</td>
                <td>Czartoryski Museum, Poland</td><td>Raphael, <i>Portrait of a Young Man</i>, $100 million</td><td>more than $100 million</td><td>1939</td></tr>
            <tr><td>5.</td>
                <td>Mahmoud Khalil Museum, Cairo, Egypt</td><td>Vincent Van Gogh, <i>Poppy Flowers</i>, $55 million</td><td>$55 million</td><td>2010</td></tr>
            <tr><td>6.</td>
                <td>Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam, The Netherlands</td><td>Rembrandt Van Rijn, <i>View of the Sea at Scheveningen</i>and <i>Congregation Leaving the Reformed Church in Nuenen</i>, $30 million</td><td>$30 million</td><td>December 7, 2002</td></tr>
            <tr><td>7.</td>
                <td>Kunsthal Museum, Rotterdam, The Netherlands</td><td>Seven masterpieces by Pablo Picasso, Claude Monet, Henri Matisse, and Lucian Freud, $24 million</td><td>$24 million</td><td>October, 2012</td></tr>
            <tr><td>8. </td>
                <td>Oratory of San Lorenzo, Sicily</td><td>Caravaggio, <i>Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence </i>, $20 million</td><td>$20 million</td><td>October, 1969</td></tr>
            <tr><td>9. </td>
                <td>Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, England</td><td>Paul Cezzane,<i> View of Auvers-sur-Oise</i>, $4.5 million</td><td>$4.5 million</td><td>December 31, 1999</td></tr>
            <tr><td>10. </td>
                <td>Saint Bavo’s Cathedral, Ghent, Belgium</td><td>Jan Van Eyck, <i>The Just Judges</i>, 1 million Belgian francs</td><td>1 million Belgium francs</td><td>April 10, 1934</td></tr>

            </tbody></table>

        </br>

        <div class="source"><i>Source:</i> financesonline.com.</div>
    </div>

    <br />

    

    
    <!--/BodyText-->

<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">

	<div class="context noindex"> <a href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a> &gt; <a href="A0150212.html">Music</a></div>

    <h1 class="level1" id="topradioplay2008">2013 Top 10 Most Played Songs</h1>
	<p align="center">The following table lists the title and artist of the top ten most played songs in the United States during 2013.</p>
    <!--BodyText-->

    <div class="center">
     <table class="sgmltable centered" id="toptenplayedsongs2010" border="1">
        <tbody>
        
        <tr>

        
            <th>Rank </th><th>Song </th><th>Artist</th><th>Total Audience</th></tr> <tr><td>1. </td>
            <td>Blurred Lines</td>
            <td>Robin Thicke feat. T.I. &amp; Pharrell</td>
            <td>673,000</td></tr> <tr><td>2. </td>
            <td>Mirrors</td>
            <td>Justin Timberlake</td>
            <td>568,000</td></tr> <tr><td>3. </td>
            <td>Stay</td>
            <td>Rihanna feat. Mikky Ekko</td>
            <td>519,000</td></tr> <tr><td>4. </td>
            <td>When I Was Your Man</td>
            <td>Bruno Mars</td>
            <td>517,000</td></tr> <tr><td>5. </td>
            <td>Locked Out of Heaven</td>
            <td>Bruno Mars</td>
            <td>514,000</td></tr> <tr><td>6. </td><td>Ho Hey</td>
            <td>Lumineers</td>
            <td>502,000</td></tr> <tr><td>7. </td>
            <td>Radioactive</td>
            <td>Imagine Dragons</td>
            <td>493,000</td></tr> <tr><td>8. </td>
            <td>Just Give Me a Reason</td>
            <td>Pink feat. Nate Ruess</td>
            <td>479,000</td></tr> <tr><td>9. </td>
            <td>Can't Hold Us</td>
            <td>Macklemore &amp; Ryan Lewis feat. Ray Dalton</td>
            <td>464,000</td></tr> <tr><td>10. </td><td>Suit &amp; Tie</td>
            <td>Justin Timberlake feat. Jay Z</td>
            <td>462,000</td>

        </tr>
      </tbody></table>
<p></p>
      <div class="note">From 2013 Calendar Year.</div>
      <div class="source"><i>Source:</i> Billboard Hot 100 Airplay / The Nielsen Company.</div>
    </div>


    <br />

    

    <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" class="PageLinearNav noindex">
      <tr>

        </td>

      
      </tr>
    </table>

    
    <!--/BodyText-->

	<div class="context noindex"> <a href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a> &gt; <a href="A0150212.html">Music</a></div>

   <!--BodyText-->
<h1 class="ftitle">Top 10 Selling Albums, 2014</h1>	
    
	<p>The following table lists the rank, title, and artist for each of the top ten selling albums in the United States during 2014.</p>
 
    <!--BodyText-->
 
    <div class="center">
      <table class="sgmltable centered" id="toptensellingalbums" border="1">
        <tbody>
        
        <tr>
 
         <th>Rank</th><th> Title </th><th>Artist</th></tr> 
         
         <tr><td>1. </td>
         <td><i>Frozen </i></td>
         <td>Soundtrack</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>2.</td>
         <td><i>Beyonce</i></td>
         <td>Beyonce</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>3.</td>
         <td><i>1989</i></td><td>Taylor Swift</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>4.</td>
         <td> <i>Midnight Memories</i></td>
         <td>One Direction</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>5.</td>
         <td><i>The Marshall Mathers LP 2</i></td>
         <td>Eminem</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>6.</td>
         <td><i>Pure Heroine</i></td>
         <td>Lorde</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>7.</td>
         <td><i>Crash My Party</i></td>
         <td>Luke Bryan</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>8. </td>
         <td><i>Prism</i></td>
         <td>Katy Perry</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>9. </td>
         <td><i>Blame It All on My Roots</i></td>
         <td>Garth Brooks</td></tr> 
         <tr><td>10. </td>
         <td><i>Here's to the Good Times</i></td>
         <td>Florida Georgia Line</td></tr> 
      
      </tbody></table>
 
</br>
 
      <div class="source"><i>Source:</i> Billboard 200: Year End 2014.</div>
    </div>
   

    

  

    
    <!--/BodyText-->

<td align="left" valign="top" id="Pg">

	<div class="context noindex"> <a href="/ent.html">Arts and Entertainment</a> &gt; <a href="A0150212.html">Music</a></div>

    <h1 class="level1" id="A0934904">Top 10 Selling Streamed Songs, 2014</h1>
		<p align="center">The following table lists the top ten streamed songs of 2014.</p>

    <div align="center">
        <!--BodyText-->
          
  </div>
    <div align="center">
  <style type="text/css">
table.tableizer-table {border: 1px solid #CCC; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;} .tableizer-table td {padding: 4px; margin: 3px; border: 1px solid #ccc;}
.tableizer-table th {background-color: #104E8B; color: #FFF; font-weight: bold;}
</style>
        
  <table class="tableizer-table">
    <tr class="tableizer-firstrow">
      <th align="left" style="font-size:13px" valign="top">Rank&nbsp;Song Artist</th>

         
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;1. Dark Horse / Katy Perry feat. Juicy J</td>

        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;2. Fancy / Iggy Azalea feat. Charli XCX</td>

        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;3. Happy / Pharrell Williams</td>

        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;4. All Of Me / John Legend</td>

         
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;5. Let It Go / Idina Menzel</td>

    
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;6. All About That Bass / Meghan Trainor</td>

        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;7. Problem / Ariana Grande feat. Iggy Azalea</td>

       
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;8. Talk Dirty / Jason Derulo feat. 2 Chainz</td>

        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;9. Rude / Magic!</td>

       
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td align="left" valign="top">10. Timber / Pitbull feat. Ke$ha</td>

        </tr>
      </table>

      
      <div class="source"><i>Source:</i> Nielsen SoundScan. &copy; 2014,
      Nielsen Media Research.</div>
    </div>

    <br />

      <tr>
